Reviews.Title: “Top notch lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice the staff are very courteous, helpful and friendly. Rooms/suites are very spacious and to a good standard. The icing on the cake was the receptionist asked if our visit was a special stay?. I informed him it was our 10 yr anniversary, when we returned later in the day we found 2 glasses and a bottle of fizzy stuff on a sliver plate in our suite. A lovely gesture, which made our stay all the more special. Thank you Donetella, we will be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service !!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBoy6
Reviews.Content: We just finished our family holiday to Venice and stayed at Residence Grimani based on our review of trip advisor. The reviews are not wrong.We have stayed in Venice a couple of times now and this has to be the best place we have stayed in in respect of location and the hospitality of the staff. We arrived early by water taxi( 70 euros from piazza Roma) which was nice and quick and arrives right out the front of the hotel. The staff were very nice and showed us to our room and gave us plent of advice as to the best restaurants and places to go. The superior room we had was located on the corner of the building with beautiful views over the canal. the hotel is very central and is between the rialto bridge and san marco square so it is very central and ideally located for anyone visiting venice. The apartment was clean and tidy and big for european standards and represented good value for our family of four - no breakfast included, free wifi which was good. There is a reason why the hotel is well rated on trip advisor and this is due to its great location and friendly staff. If we ever return to venice we would stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rgibo
Reviews.Content: Family midweek Easter city break in Venice for 3 nights stay in the â€˜Residence Corte Grimani hotelâ€™. The location of this hotel is excellent, within easy walking distance of all the major tourist sites in Venice (2 minutes walk from St Marks Square, 5 minutes walk from Rialto Bridge). The apartment we stayed in was easily large enough for the four of us (2 adults 2 children 11 & 12) with a small Kitchenette in one room, however we didnâ€™t make use of this. The hotel is room only with no restaurant however the there is no shortage of great restaurants only a stoneâ€™s throw from the front door. We had a great meal at the Hard Rock Cafe just down the road from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us which added to the family friendly feel to the hotel. The only small down side with the room was you could hear the other guests in the room above which could be a bit noisy. However we were so shattered from sightseeing this did not prove to be much of a problem. Tip.. if youâ€™re a light sleeper it might be worth taking ear plugs just in case. All in all, top rate â€˜no frillsâ€™ small hotel in an excellent location helped to make this a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “HONEST AND TRUSTWORTHY - THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: vopuez
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Venice by train for the first time with my partner back in Dec'11.. and arrived fairly late in the evening. The place was a bit hard to find at night as most corners look just about the same to us. But once we found the hotel, we were warmly received by the kind gentlemen who worked there. The rooms were big and spacious. Centrally located and easily accessible. What I really must comment on were the friendliness and honesty of the staff members. Unknown to me, we're required to hand in our passports for verification upon checking in. I had a big note of EUR clipped in my wallet and without realizing, had handed my passport and my cash to the counter. It was only much later that I realized I didn't have my cash with me. The hotel staff were aware that my cash was with my passport and safe kept it for me. To which I am very greatful for. Also, a staff namely Maurizio were so kind to us. He told us of the best local restaurants to go to, for which I've enjoyed the best tiramisu in the world! Of all things that could've been said - this place is simply the best for me and I would most definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: holiday456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at these lovely apartments just before Easter for 4 nights. We arrived by water taxi which was a breath taking welcome to this beautiful city and our children loved arriving by boat right to the door. As a family of 4 we had plenty of space in a one bed apartment with a pull out sofa bed for our two small children. We had a nice view over the canal and looking towards San Marco Piazza. The staff were lovely. Very helpful with restaurant recommendations, and advice on negotiating our return journey back to the airport via the vaporetto. Venice is an expensive city to visit but we managed to eat really well and I didn't feel we over extended our budget at all. The coffee/pastry shops are wonderful. Fresh strawberries and shell your own peas from the Rialto market a must. Our kids had a fantastic time trying out their Italian on the stall holders who were wonderfully indulgent. You will not go wrong with a stay at the Corte Grimani. Its location could not be better and the staff were fantastic! Thanks for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lanedomain
Reviews.Content: We found the Corte Grimani an excellent choice for a family of 5, which in Europe is difficult to accommodate in one room. The Corte Grimani had a suite with 3 queen-size beds, perfect for putting the kids in one room and having privacy in the other. We especially enjoyed having two bathrooms and a crazy little washer/dryer in one, which saved us from spending a morning at the lavenderia. Friendly staff, clean, well-run, and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: ccrwisconsinUSA
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a 2 room apartment. It was very big and perfectly clean. The two bathrooms were especially nice. We were on 4th floor and had a nice view of the canal. We walked from the water bus stop at San Marco and found it easily and quickly from the detailed directions on hotels website. The beds were good, but firm. Firm beds seem to be the norm in Italy. The staff were spectacular. They were helpful, bilingual and courteous and kind. They were the best part of the hotel. All in all it was a great stay (3 days). The only drawback is it is noisy sometimes at night. People on the bridge over canal, yelling and clattering around at night. My girls whom are usually very sound sleepers were awakened 2/3 nights by yelling. I think this is not the norm based on other reviews. They have a fridge for your use and an electric kettle. Though instant coffee only offered the first day of our stay and not refilled when housekeeping cleaned our rooms. Staff directed us to take away coffee and patisserie shops very close by that were good. Venice was lovely and easily walked, this hotels location was good, it has a nice elevator for hauling luggage to room and rooms are spacious. Cost seems good also, for Venice. It's a good place for families plenty of room for the 4 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: HectorGS
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Corte Grimani. Staff we always willing to help... in fact, all their restaurant recommendations proved incredibly good. Rooms are spacious and well kept. Very easy to reach from St Marks Square and Ponte Rialto. Only downside is they cannot serve breakfast, but it apparently is a local law or regulation. We would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment, great locatin, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Chip G
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of minutes walk to S Marco. Our room was nice, separate bedroom with a queen and living room/kitchen area with a pullout sofa. Price was good and the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: RVASarah
Reviews.Content: We found a wonderful hotel, with lots of space, immaculately clean, and lovely rooms only 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge or St. Mark's. The Residence Corte Grimani is family-owned, and they are friendly and helpful. We had read so much about tight spaces and seedy hotels in Venice that we expected the worst. Our apartment was two generous rooms with two bathrooms, a sitting area and a kitchen area. The furniture was fresh and simple. The floors were tiled and the old beams were exposed. We were up at the rooftops, overlooking a little canal and lots of red tile roofs. There is an extra charge if you are going to really cook meals in your kitchen, and it's fully stocked if you want to. If you just plan to use it for snacks and light meals, there's no charge. Ask the staff for help with finding things or recommending restaurants. They are very happy to help. It was a perfect spot for a family with two college-aged children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: plbaird2000
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations. Apartment was updated and spacious for European standards. Very centrally located. St. Marks around the corner one way and the Rialto bridge the other. WI-FI worked great in the room. Owners and staff very welcoming, kind and helfpful. I was concerned abou thte kitchen and 50 euro charge for full use, but we found the use wihtout the charge worked great for us. We had coffee/tea, breakfast & snacks in the room, whcih helped save money and kept the kids happy. Would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GJKAnchorageAK
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights there and wished we could have stayed in Venice longer. This hotel is in a great location to walk everywhere in Venice. The hotel staff were very friendly and the rooms were very large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: NTHurrrzz
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in a great location just minutes from St Marks yet very quiet. All the people at the hotel were very friendly and efficient, making the stay a pleasure. The rooms were really one apartments with living room, table and chairs, kitchen and a separate bedroom. This worked out great as we got the bedroom and our daughter got the other room with a sofa bed (which was the best sofabed we've ever seen - it felt like a bed). It meant you were never falling over each other. You could pay extra 50â‚¬ for them to unlock all the equipment in the kitchen to cover the extra cleaning. However they still leave you plenty of stuff without paying this - cups, glasses, plates and cutlery. Certainly enough for having some nibbles. I would recommend getting a watertaxi from the airport to the hotel. We had never been to Venice and really was a spectacular way to arrive at the steps of the hotel. The boats are beautiful and trip zooming across to Venice in the misty distance the through the canals even up the grand canal was something we'll remember forever. Another tip is t get a travelcard. Jumping on an off the waterbus is a great way to get another perspective. We particualrly enjoyed taking the No1 anticlockwise from the grand canal around past the train station - and what felt out to sea before coming back to San Giorgio Maggiore across from St marks.

Reviews.Title: “... a triumph for Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: clive063
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor led us to this gem. With two teenage children an appartment style setup suits far better than two hotel rooms and this is what this venue offers in a great location at a fair price. Let's hope the universally positive reviews (which are correct) do not spoil it. I loved the two minute walk to the bakery to buy breakfast... and then have cappucino brought to you room by the hotel. I was grateful for the restaurant advice that was sound as well as assitance in booking La Traviata at the Musica a Palazzo....... and the best bit?? Having a water taxi pull up outside the front door for our departure and the trip through the smaller canals!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury In Venice”
Reviews.Author: neil s
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable to say the least. The best of locations near San Marco square. Huge rooms. Amazing furniture and decorations. The best of service. Staff highly professional. Cant recommend anything better in Venice although we visited quite a few splendid hotels on prior trips to Venice. Overa;; on eof the best and warmest facilities we have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing apartment it was huge plenty of room”
Reviews.Author: Geoff S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2011 - we found this hotel on the web are we glad we did fantastic location close to everything. We caught the water taxi from the airport and it drops you off right at the door and this is where the service starts. The Manager and his staff was so friendly they could not do enough for us. Rooms large and very clean they have full kitchen facilities if you require them. The only negative was the wi-fi was not available in the room I had to go to the foyer but it worked ok here. But overall we would recommend to anybody wanting to stay close to all the attractions in Venice this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So happy here!”
Reviews.Author: Edye
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, friendliest staff and so nice to have an apartment for our family of 4. Very comfortable unit on top floor. Lovely view, so quiet except for bell tower and gondolas and water taxis occasionally passing by. Better to see New Year's Eve fireworks from our room than in San Marco square! Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of venice”
Reviews.Author: Ser579
Reviews.Content: Great apartment style room. We arrived about 7.30ish and took a water taxi that wouldn't go directly to the hotel like previous reviews. Would probably suggest doing the 6 euro Water bus rather than the 60 euro water taxi. I think it wouldnt take much longer. Hotel itself was fantastic but little difficult to find initially. Very central location and service was great. Loved hearing the guys singing around the canals from the room in the afternoon. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: LilMissTravels79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days. The room is quite spacious as the bedroom and living room area are separate. The rooms and bathroom are very clean, and are cleaned everyday. For an extra 50â‚¬ you can use the full kitchen, otherwise you have access only to some cups, plates and cutlery. The staff were very helpful with tips on where to eat. We got a room on the 5th floor and had a view of the canal. The hotel is a 5min walk to San Marco. It is difficult to find though, but very quiet because it's tucked away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location. Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: ebonaven
Reviews.Content: Easy walking access to all places in Venice. Location could not be better. Rooms are very large. We are a family of 5 (2 teenagers and a 6 yo) and were very comfortable with more than enough space for us and for our bags. We didn't use the kitchenette and I am not sure if you could actually cook there. The view from our room was spectacular. All windows overseeing a small canal. Very helpful staff. The room was spotlessly clean. Very good shower. Very good mattress. I will definitely use this hotel again in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: nistock
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, comfortable, clean, friendly, spacious room, a well priced haven in an expensive city. It is situated on a canal with easy walking access to St Marks and Rialto, equidistant and only 5 minutes away. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Dean L
Reviews.Content: Was a nice apartment style lodging. We stayed for two nights. Excellent location near St Mark's and Rialto. Our room had a canal / street view - not the main canal though. Clean, and free wifi which was excellent. Staff were also friendly and helpful re directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: phoongy
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in september. super spacious, clean, and beautiful hotel. staff was kind and friendly, helpful with directions and info. price was unbeatable. room was clean and air conditioner was freezing us to death. location just a few steps from san marco plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely - it has a fantastic location! My boyfriend was able to find the hotel really easily from the water bus. The hotel is not far from one of the main Gondola Pick-Up points (â‚¬60 we paid for a 45 minute ride and it took us all around, including the Rialto Bridge). Around the hotel there are some fantastic cheap restaurants - the hotel recommended us some fantastic places too - and there is the Hard Rock Cafe not far either. You can eat cheaply in Venice if you avoid the tourist traps, this hotel makes it much easier to eat on the back-streets of Venice. All the back streets are on our door-step which meant we could buy some lovely souvenirs and walk around the shops and soak up the atmosphere. We had breakfast in different places each day managing to find lovely food on every corner which wasn't too expensive. There is food everywhere - ice-cream, Pizza slices - oh I could go on - the food is fantastic there and I've never eaten so well! The apartments were lovely - plain in decoration, but lots of space (a big bed!) and very clean. We found the cleaners to be very noisy first thing in the morning which was a shame as we wanted to lie-in over the weekend - without noise! We found that we didn't use the kitchen for cooking but we did bring some food back so was good to eat this off plates etc. Beware; there is a â‚¬50 cleaning charge for the kitchen if you do leave it in a mess. My only complaint about the hotel is that the check in and out times are rather inconvenient - 4pm checking in time and 10am checking out! You can leave luggage at the hotel and we found the reception to be helpful and knowledgeable about the area and were efficient in ordering us a water taxi (which we picked up directly outside the hotel). The water taxi is a must, we arrived at night and I would say to get a water taxi in the day when you can see where your going and enjoy the experience a bit more. My boyfriend felt like James Bond and loved it!! They are pricey though... Overall this hotel has a simply fantastic location for Venice and sight-seeing - we spend Â£180 per night which we got though the hotel website, this is cheap for Venice and I'm happy to recommend this to friends. The hotel is a pleasant walk away from St Mark's Square and the main point to get the airport. We visited Doges Palace which was lovely - we got there early and there was already a queue so maybe early afternoon is the time to go. We didn't have much time in Venice and we spent most of our time walking around, eating and enjoying the beauty. Venice is a stunning place and one of my favourite destinations - we had little time in Venice and this hotel helped to maximise our trip to its fullest. Overall would I return to the hotel - absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rajennd
Reviews.Content: No wonder this place has won an award from Tripadvisor! Very central location, very friendly and helpful staff. It was a pleasure to stay here for a week and would surely come back. The rooms are well furnished, spacious and clean. I did not find it noisy the shops where one can pick up food and grocery are so close by. Rajen India

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: allan38
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here. Great location just 5 mins from St Mark's and just round the corner from Bacino Orseolo Gondole, which added to our Venetian experience. We loved watching the gondolas pass below our balcony and hearing the gondaliers sing as they glided by ("Ciao Venezia" was annoyingly catchy). The rooms were large and clean but not convinced the kitchen facilities would be worth while as there is an additional 50 EUR charge. There is free wifi in the lobby which was useful and allowed my daughter to feed her Facebook habit. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English and made us feel very welcome. When we return to Venice we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: luigipace
Reviews.Content: On the spur of the moment, my wife and I along with my sister and her husband, planned a last minute trip from Firenze to Venezia, the night before we left we logged in to TA and started looking for a place to stay in Venezia and we chose Corte Grimani based on the reviews we read. Let me tell you that this was a great place to stay, the rooms that were assigned to us were very large and very clean. Guido who was at the front desk when we arrived and the rest of the staff were very helpful and extremely courteous. Even though it is a little more expensive than i would normally spend it was definitely worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Back street gem”
Reviews.Author: Scotlandtvl
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between San Marco Square and Rialto. Apartment was reasonable size - lounge with sofabed and kitchenette, bedroom and bathroom. Owners were very helpful with advice about restaurants etc. Rooms were clean and comfortable. As floors were not carpeted the noise from upstairs was slightly annoying but apart from that I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit - just as lovely as the first.”
Reviews.Author: Pynchon1927
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Corte Grimani. The room was gorgeous: spacious, comfortable and beautifully appointed. The very special character of this hotel lies in its staff - notably Donatella and Guido who have run the hotel since its inception. They spare no effort in making guests feel at home. Despite being only a few steps away from St. Marks, its location is peaceful and quiet. As noted by other guests, you can hear furniture being moved in apartments above, but this did not bother us. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Very large rooms”
Reviews.Author: TraceyCairns
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartment. It was so big which is unusual in Europe. We loved the view of the canal from the window and could often hear the lovely Italy Piano accordian players on the Gondola's paddling by. The streets around this area are a maze, so it is worthwhile organising a map to find your way from Rialto to the apartment. It is also very close to SAN MARCO. So the location was perfect for sightseeing, eating & shopping. Rooms very very clean, spacious and comfortable. Great staff also !

Reviews.Title: “After a difficult begining we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mysuitcase5
Reviews.Content: We arrieved with a water Taxi at the apartment Hotel at 11.30 pm after a long train journey, we were informed that there was a plumbing problem with our apartment and we had to move to a nearby Hotel ( Hotel Serenissima I wrote a seperate review ) we were not happy at all. But the next morning after apologizing many times by the frendly staff we could enjoy the apartment we booked. The apartment was on the first floor very spacious clean and nicely decorated we enjoyed the kitchen (extra fee) and prepared great Italian meals! Geat location for walking around Venice. I hope we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dindin_77
Reviews.Content: Great location. Do not go with Google maps, that does not take into consideration the bridges. We took the water taxi and as the hotel is on a canal, it was directly to the hotel door. The hotel is an apartment hotel, located between RIALTO and SAN MARCO, close to food shops (Piazza San Luca), so many times we had meals in the apartment. Saving money. We got complementary tickets for the biennial exhibition. The using of washing machine cost 15 Euro, and the savon 1 Euro. All in all very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: LizzyWizzy66
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed in one of the large suites at the Residence Corte Grimani in June. Unfortunately, the water taxi driver from the Santa Lucia train station informed us after we were 5 minutes into the trip that he couldn't take us direct to the hotel. He claimed that his boat wouldn't fit in the small canal at the Grimani which we found out was not true (we were picked up by a water taxi upon departure). We were dropped at the Piazza San Marco dock and had to hoof it across the cobblestones to the Residence. We had backpacks so it wasn't a big problem but it would have been nice to go direct because the Residence Corte Grimani is not to easy to find the first time. We had Google Maps to help out but passed it twice! Keep your eyes peeled when you cross the bridge past all of the gondolas. If you pass the Armani shop then you have gone too far! The Residence Corte Grimani is very centrally located between the Rialto area and Piazza San Marco. My niece and I walked to the Piazza every evening and enjoyed the wonderful music at the Grancaffe Quadri until closing time. It was a short walk back and we felt very safe. The apartment was very large and very nice. Our only complaint was the noise from the apartment above us. It seemed that the guests were dragging furniture across the floor on a constant basis. This is not the fault of the hotel and I did complain upon checkout which was a bit too late. The canal below our windows was full each morning with gondolas and the singing and laughing will get you up in the morning. Who needs to sleep late while in Venice though? I would recommend the Residence Corte Grimani but would advise to complain about the noise if it's a problem. The front desk advised me that they would have informed the guests that they were too loud. I try to be tolerant and not a big complainer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: XanderJ
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice because it was very clean. The location was excellent because it is near Piazza San Marco. The service is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gypsygirlforever
Reviews.Content: I took my mother ( who could not walk too far ) and 3 teenage girls to Venice. This was the ideal place . We were thrilled with its location. In the evenings you could watch and hear the gondola's right outside the front door . The area seemed very safe and my teenagers did a lot of exploring and followed some of the walks suggested in the guide books ( a great thing to do ) . We would buy food in the market in the mornings for the day and having a kitchen so we could eat when and what we liked. Eating out was crazy - the food charge - the " to pop your botton in a seat charge " the service charge !! It was too much for the quality of food we were being served. This residence sold water and wine at great prices . The staff could not have been more helpful. This to me was a perfect , family , friend and couples place to stay. Thank you to all the staff. The staff arranged a water taxi to the train station the day we left , this and a trip to the islands were some of our favourite memories.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our Italian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TMak_11
Reviews.Content: We were extremely best with this hotel from the moment we stepped off the water at the Rialto ferry stop and followed the directions straight to the hotel. The hotel is located so centrally, but doesn't have the touristy feel that some of the areas do. The room exceeded our expecations as it was a full apartment that was very spacious, clean and pleasant. Every staff member we dealt with was excellent. When I make it back to Venice I will definately stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay and enjoy the Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: MLaguna
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone else who has reviewed this hotel. I booked it after noticing that this is one of the few hotels in Venice that has been rated either Excellent or Very Good by everyone who has stayed there. The ratings are well-justified. My family and I stayed two nights and the apartment was very comfortable, with modern amenities and the view from it was unmatched. This is, without a question, one of the best places to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ktr614
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location. The room size was big, clean and very comfortable. Staff were friendly and professional. Ditto what everyone says in their reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and great value for families”
Reviews.Author: seamusandandy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was an easy find from Rialto and offered a warm welcome. Apartment was huge and well appointed. Very quiet rooms but we loved the windows that opened onto the canal and its regular gondola traffic (and singers!). Handy to markets, grocery stores, and tourist sites and free wifi was great. The laundry was handy (and cheaper than the nearby laundromat) and valued as this was a long trip for us. A great value in a city that knows how to separate tourists from their euros :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Bentom99
Reviews.Content: Very nice accommodation. Very helpful staff. In a great location in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrific!”
Reviews.Author: jets60
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here in the 2 room apartment - a huge bedroom with a sleeper sofa, table and chairs and ensuite bathroom, a kitchen/living room with another sleeper sofa, table and chairs and another bathroom! There was even a washer/dryer. The place was absolutely enormous and so well-appointed. The best part of all was the location - a short walk to San Marco and Rialto Bridge and with 2 canals right outside. We had windows on 3 sides so could see and hear everything with the windows open (but nothing with them closed). The water taxi was able to drop off and pick up at the front door so it was really convenient with luggage. It was so charming and the staff was fantastic and really helpful (they stored our luggage for almost an entire day after check out). We will stay here again (and again and again!). We love a beautiful hotel and have stayed in several in Venice but the Corte Grimani was absolutely terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Runningmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of six spent two nights at this hotel in late July. It was a great choice - we stayed in a two room apartment. One room had a queen bed and a sofa bed. The other room had another sofa bed and a kitchenette. The sofa beds were comfortable and the unit also had 2 bathrooms. What I liked the best about the hotel: the staff was friendly and very helpful, the hotel was very clean and roomy, the view was great over a small canal, the location was fantastic - minutes away from San Marco's Square and the Rialto Bridge. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: php-aqua
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a relaxing anniversary weekend here and loved every minute. The location is convenient (walking distance to most attractions) which was great in the evenings as there were lots of good restaurants nearby. The room was superb with a lovely balcony and wooden beams. The staff were really helpful and gave us excellent recommendations of where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wdytya13303
Reviews.Content: Location is great, just getting there by water taxi is a lot of fun, no walking through the streets with your bags. Accommodation is within a 5 mintue walk to St Mark's Square. Staff are very helpful, they suggested great places to eat,and reasonably priced places to shop. It had been newly renovated when we were there so it was a clean, pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel in advanced with a room with a balcony view, but once we arrived the room did not have the A/C working, so they offered us a different room. The hotel is cozy with nothing ultra special, just what you expect from a hotel. The rooms are really large, ours came with two rooms, breakfast area, kitchenette with not utensils? I thought that was a little weird, bathroom was clean and normal size. My favorite decor from the rooms were the wooden beams in the rooms!! they were rustic and beautiful to see. The gentleman at the front desk was very very helpful and nice to talk to, although I was a little preoccupied for our passports when he requested them and left them at the desk and went to show us the apartment! But I guess I am just a little extra cautious... Overall this hotel is what it is; a hotel with great clean rooms and great staff! Although I think if I came back to Venice I would stay in a different hotel, just because I would like to try something different, not that I would not stay here again, I really like it!

Reviews.Title: “a real find”
Reviews.Author: happilyretired060
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it a real gem . Excellent location only 5 mins walk from the water bus at Rialto or San Marco yet very quiet at night. Appartment spacious comfortable and clean although the cost to fully use the kitchen at 50 euros is a littlte steep. Staff very helpful and in the perfect spot to explore Venice

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: Europe-07-09-11
Reviews.Content: First I think the positive reviews were an understatement. We like high end hotels so were concerned by the apartment nature. The location is perfect and we've been to Venice three times recently. You can take a water taxi direct to the steps of the hotel for 70E from the train station. People say this is a luxury but worth it. If you're on the fence, this was the best taxi we've had due to the route the guy took. It wound around and was a surprisingly nice long tour. I think our place was maybe 800 sq feet, simply massive by European standards. Clean, comfortable, etc. Not luxurious but nice. The washer dryer were a huge plus. In the end though the stand out feature is the service. Beyond compare. New home in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous2535
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Residence Corte Grimani during our recent trip to Venice and absolutely fell in love with this hotel. It was in a great location very close to San Marco Square, amazing restaurants, and right on a beautiful canal. During the day, gondolas would pass by and often had singers on board which was nice to listen to from our bedroom window during the day. The exterior of the hotel was beautiful. The interior of both the main areas and our room were phenomenal. The rooms were extremely spacious for Europe and especially for the cost. Throughout the living room, sitting room, and bedrooms there were beautiful wood beams on the ceiling, and everything was very nicely decorated and modern. I appreciated that the hotel did a great job of having modern amenities and style while still keeping the old Venice feel. Last, but not least, the staff was very kind and accommodating and even offered great suggestions for shopping and restaurants. I absolutely cannot wait to go back to Venice and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location”
Reviews.Author: jimborooney
Reviews.Content: The Corte Grimani is a spotless modern hotel in an older building that is both stylish and comfortable. The staff is efficient and professional and provided excellent restaurant recommendations and arranged a water taxi to the airport. The taxi can pick up and drop off right at the front door so was very convenient. The only downside is that the hotel does not provide breakfast, but one of the best pastry shops in town is a short walk. It was a bit of a splurge for us to stay here but it was worth it. We had two separate, very spacious rooms for our family, and the hotel was quiet and well air conditioned. Note: Internet access in room is wired only (they provide cord) but this won't work for iPad or iPhone. They have wireless in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent residence hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mihirgandhi
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel very close to St. Mark's square, right in the heart of the city. The rooms have a living room, small kitchenette, and a big bedroom, very nicely furnished and good service with free wi-fi in the reception. We were 2 couples who were staying in the hotel and had a great time! Will definitely be back to this place when next in Venice (hopefully soon!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: MickeySpore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the canal, so your taxi can come right up next to the hotel. However, on the day we arrived, the water level was too high for the taxi to navigate under the bridges. The canal view from our room is most charming. We had a 2 bedroom apartment for 6 people. The room is spacious, immaculately clean and tastefully decored. Bathroom items are all new! The staff was helpful and courteous. The hotel is very well located, and 5 min walking distance to the St Marco. Room did not come with breakfast, but there are breakfast options around the hotel to suit the budget. As we are right next to the canal, the morning can be a bit noisy as the gondolas & service boats start to ply by. Otherwise, a small and beautiful hotel - quite a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Eric_S_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was wonderful. Very close to San Marco Square and the front door opens right up to a little canal. The staff there was extremely nice and helpful. The rooms were very clean and for Europe, very large! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great suite hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JPMZ
Reviews.Content: This isn't a traditional hotel nor is it an apartment - it's something like an Embassy Suites with a living/dining/kitchen room separate from the bedroom. Much more enjoyable than a hotel room. Exceptionally clean - it looked like no one had stayed in the room before us. We asked if they had just remodeled the room, but they said it's just top rate housekeeping. Bed was very comfortable - no problem sleeping. Front desk service was great and provided excellent recommendations and a really good map. Free wi-fi available in the lobby only. No meal service, not even breakfast, but one of the most popular (with locals) breakfast/bakeries in Venice is within 2-3 minutes walk. And as others have noted, it is a very short walk to St. Marks - and the surprising thing is that the hotel is so quiet considering how centrally it is located. Not inexpensive, but still delivers a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: Guacharaca
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Corte Grimani at the beginning of June and I don't understand why this hotel is not nr 1 on the list, it's the best hotel in Venice ever!! The apartments are huge and lovely, the location is the best, you can walk everywhere, and the view from our room couldn't be beaten, it faced the canal, it was great to have breakfast by the window watching the gondoliers go by, we even had our private concert, because one morning one of the tourists that happened to be a soprano was singing as the gondola passed by. The hosts are great also, thanks Donatella and Guido for a lovely stay, sorry I didn't catch the name of the other person that works at night, he was very nice also. Thanks to you all!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: CissiSweden
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five, and we stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in June 2011. The location of this hotel is excellent, situated approximately 3-5 minutes walk from St Mark's Square. The hotel is located right by a channel, so the water taxi can drop you of at the front gate. The staff speak english very well and are extremely helpful. Upon arriving, we were given a map of the city, information about good restaurants and "do's and dont's" about Venice. We were upgraded from a "classical" to a "superior" room free of charge (room n:o 301 with a view of the channel, a spacious bedroom with a double bed and a sofa bed, two bathrooms and a livingroom). The livingroom was equipped with a sofa bed and a kitchenette (nice to be able to prepare breakfast and a few simple meals), featuring sink, electric stove, dishwasher, fridge with a freezer compartment etc. No breakfast was served at the hotel but could be bought at nearby restaurants or shops. Hot or cold drinks could be purchased at the hotel. The hotel was quiet at night (indeed as is almost all Venice, due to the lack of cars). The air-condition worked perfectly and there was free internet access. All the apartment was very clean and not run-down at all. This is absolutely our best hotel experience we've had when travelling abroad, and we recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel with a good cost-value relationship.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel560
Reviews.Content: Unlike all the other "hotel rooms" we stayed in during our trip to Italy, this hotel features roomy apartments, which was a relief if you are tired of the small rooms elsewhere. The front desk service was exceptionally cordial and competent. The location is equally convenient (<5 mins walking) from both the Rialto bridge and the San Marco square. Our apartment didn't have a view of the canal and the gondolas, but was quiet and restful. There is a separate charge of 50 Euros for the use of the kitchen and possibly laundry equipment too. The bathroom was spacious and everything worked very well. Well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Apartment and Service”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in april for 2 nights. Location of apartment is very good and central. Very safe to walk about and 3 minutes walk from hard rock cafe and san marco. Room is very comfortable and spacious, used the washer/dryer in the apartment, very happy that we can wash and clean our clothes everyday. The best thing is that there is lots of electrical sockets to plug in and charge our phones, lap tops and Ipad. House keeping is good and restaurants recomended by the hotel is good especially the tiny one next to a canal. All of us love this place and all had very good sleep here, slept longer than we normally would. We had the best sleep quality in this place during our entire trip in italy, one of the reasons could be there is no cars in venice hence the noise level from the street is very low and the hotel is located just off the main route helps. Hotel ordered a water taxi for us for 100 euro to the airport, the trip took less than 30 minutes. We got the address of a co op supermarket from the hotel and bought cereals & hams for breakfast. Our flight by Easyjet was cancelled due to strike, hotel help us to enquire about the strike, flight cancellation as we do not speak Italian. That strike was scarry as it involved the airport ground staff, as well as railways over the enitre weekends. No seats on any italian and German Rail and air planes due to the strike. We would have to stay an extra 3 nights just to get out of Venice. The funny thing is that not all ground staff is on strike so only selected airlines cancelled their flight. Using the wifi in our room, we switch to the Air Berlin to get out of Italy, printed the tickets using the PC in the hotel Lobby. This would be our last time to Italy, infact any European countries that has frequent strike until such industrial actions dies down. Was told that the Italian transport strike is quite frequent during summers especially during festive breaks. We would recomend this place to anyone who comes to Venice, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: arancia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Corte Grimani for four nights. It was simply perfect. The location (a short stroll to S.Marco and to Rialto), the view (on a side canal), the apartment (roomy and spotless clean), the staff (kind and helpful). It's not cheap, but nothing in Venice is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Location and friendly staff and atmosphere can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: feefers
Reviews.Content: Steps away from San Marcos square. Right on a canal with pick up and drop off service by water taxi directly to hotel door (60-70 euro from train staion). Gondolas pass right by the open windows on the first level. My wife and daughter and me drank a few bottles of wine just sitting on the step toasting all the gondolas going by. Beds were comfortable and we had a unit with a fridge stove and microwave to save on food cost. We did eat out a few times and enjoyed the food but found that Venice is extremely expensive and if you're a coffe drinker, be sure to get a unit with a coffer maker. A small coffee can be as much as 4 euros (about $6.00). Very unique city but quite expensive. A once in a lifetime experience although if we hit the lottery we'd visit often. We highly recommend the Residence Corte Grimani and truly thank the management and staff for such wonderful service. Oh yeah, don't forget to bring a wash cloth (they don't provide them in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Real Venetian luxury in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: PompeyRory
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the start of our three city tour of Italy. The location is amazing being almost halfway between St Marks Square and the Rialto bridge which makes getting around Venice a breeze. The hotel itself is more of a luxury residence than a normal hotel and doesn't provide breakfast but there are plenty of coffee shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff were amazingly helpful and gave us an insight into Venice as well as helping us to pre-book the most popular tours. We stayed in one of the larger rooms which easily accomodated us and our two kids of 11 and 9 with it's two bathrooms and mini kitchenette (slight extra charge). We chose the Grimani after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and could not recommend this hotel highly enough!! This is a real jewel in the heart of Venice and a great base from which to explore. The hotel captures the real spirit of Venice and it is amazing to wake in the morning to the sound of St Marks bells and a singing Gondallier punting past your window below. Can't recommend highly enough and don't forget to book a water taxi if you come in from the airport for that real James Bond experience....

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, friendly hosts in the heart of Venetian action”
Reviews.Author: teambloopy
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable 3 night stay in April. The apartments here are huge - separate living room and bedroom. There are cooking and washing facilities available in the room for an extra fee. It was mrs b's birthday during the stay and a free bottle of prosecco was left in the fridge with a lovely note on the day (this was completely unprompted - just based on the info taken from our passports in check in). The hotel is well located to the sights of Venice and right on one of the canals. All the staff are super friendly, speak English perfectly and are more than happy to give advice and help out. Free wifi and a guest computer in the downstairs lobby. A bit pricey but the room size more than compensates for the extra cost. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments for families”
Reviews.Author: LibertyStav
Reviews.Content: This apartment is in a great location and is very comfortable. We were able to stay comfortably with our three young children. Another bonus, is the washer/dryer in the unit! The staff was wonderful and we especially appreciated the restaurant suggestions of Guido at the front desk. Were looking for authentic, casual, good food and he directed us well to avoid tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Central, stylish and convenient”
Reviews.Author: JillandJohnBath
Reviews.Content: We booked three apartments for a midweek winter break in Venice with friends. It could barely have been better. A mistake on one room allocation was rectified immediately and pleasantly with a further apology when we left. Very spacious and contemporary but with a traditional Venetian feel, exposed beams and canal views with it's own gondola landing! A little short on glasses and crockery but the kitchen facility was a real benefit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KCfan4ever
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations, would stay there again in a heartbeat. The location was perfect, the staff were extremely helpful and the room was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, clean and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WhiteFamily144
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Residence Corte Grimani. This hotel is in an excellent location walking distance to everything and the staff helpful. Our apartment had one very large double room with a large sofa bed in the large lounge area. There were 2 bathrooms. There was a kitchenette but we didn't use it for our short stay. Double check when booking the accommodation as the price we booked did not include the kitchen facilities. An extra charge is applied if you want the kitchen unlocked. Our online price was extremely reasonable for Venice accommodation so if we were staying longer we would have paid the extra for the kitchen. A tip from me.... make sure you take instructions how to find the hotel before you leave. It is easy to find the hotel once you know where you are going but finding it for the first time can be confusing.... if you have a good map you will be fine... remember you walk everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Monterey_Goods
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train and as there were 5 of us plus luggage we decided not to spend hundred of euros on water taxis but took the vaporetto and walked instead. The hotel is not easy to find but we had great directions given to us by the hotel and found it first go. It is literally about 500 metres from the Rialto Bridge in one direction and 500 metres from St Marks in the other and while Venice is not known for its street signs there are always signs to those 2 landmarks. The hotel itself was magnificent - absolutely beautiful rooms and amenities. You had to pay extra to use the stove, oven and washing machine but as we had access to a kettle and microwave for free that didn't worry us. And the free internet access in the lobby was a bonus for the teenage daughters. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. It was one of our most expensive stays on our trip but it was worth it to see Venice in style.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gvlm
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal...close to the canal. Did not even have to pay for a gondola singer since there were daily gondola rides passing by our window . Just fabulous atnmosphere in and around the hotel. The reception staff was great super helpful with recomendations and friendly. Not to mention the cleaning staff did an awesome job just like if I was doing it myself. Always spotless and very clean rooms and bathrooms. Spacious and super comfortable bed and sofa bed. We took advantage of the washer/dryer combo for just 15 Euros. This was a plus since we were able to pack less and wash our clothe for our next adventure after Venice. Close to restaurants, San Marco Piazza, bakeries just about anything you needed at walking distance...Campanas Restaurants was the best. Free Wi Fi and internet that is a plus since other hotels charge this service. The only disadvantage was that there was no breakfast included but that it okay since there are many bakeries to choose from. If traveling with babies do not bring stroller to Venice handy baby carries are better...lots of bridges to cross and it can be a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “A workfree, Stressfree Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithStDavid
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Corte Grtimani three times in the past few years. The wonderful staff of Guido, Donatella and Franca make your stay easy and effortless. The Corte Grimani is situated at the intersection of two canals off St. Mark's Square and not far from the Rialto. It is not a luxury hotel, more like a comfortable residence in a friendly neighborhood. The rooms are large and comfortable and spotlessly clean. Each of the units has a kitchen which we used mostly for breakfast. A short walk takes you to shops with fresh baked bread and croissants which you can get for a fraction of the cost of eating out, all while your coffee is brewing. Then you can eat by the window and watch Venice come awake. Location is everything in this walking city, and from the Corte Grimani you can access the major sights, shopping, restaurants, churches and that most romantic of places, St. Mark's Square at night. Moonlight and violins, who could ask for more? But if more is what you want, you can get there from here. We took the Vaporetto to St. Giorgio,, the Traghetto home from San Paolo and a water taxi to the airport, all with ease. The temptation is to keep this gem to ourselves, it is that special.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa8383
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. It is only a two minute walk to St Mark's square (literally around the corner from it) and we had a view from our room of all the gondolas floating by, which was great to see. The rooms were furnished beautifully with some pieces of antique looking furniture. Everything is new and the bathroom was very modern. You can get dropped off right at the door of this hotel if you get a private water taxi, which is handy if you have luggage. The location is perfect, the rooms had plenty of space and the beds were so nice to sleep in. I've been to five star hotels and this is definitely one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: MaryW49
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Corte Grimani. My sister refers to it as "our home away from home in Venice". It is the perfect combination of location, friendly staff, and room size and flexability. There were 4 of us this time in a large suite with a separate bedroom and living area and 2 full bathrooms. There was plenty enough room for all of us and we never felt squeezed. Guido, Franca, Donatella and the rest are the best! We sincerely hope to see them again in the years to come. Bella!

Reviews.Title: “Best night of our trip”
Reviews.Author: saltydog42
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by ferry from Porec in Croatia which was pleasant and decided to catch a water taxi straight to the hotel so we didn't have to pull our bags over the bridges and cobblestones ( thanks to previous trip advisors for this fantastic advice). This was an absolutely wonderful way to start our two days in Venice and in our experience well worth the money. We were welcomed by a very friendly lady who told us we had been upgraded. We booked a suite with a view but were blown away with a very elegant suite with two bathrooms (one even had a bath which seems to be something unusual in our experience in both Italy and Croatia), a huge amount of space and lounge dining/kitchen area. I know the kitchen costs more to use but we had no intention of using it as eating out, for our family, is one of the pleasures for us of being on holiday. Our boys shared a double bed which from memory was a sofa bed in the lounge room but they have got used to this on the holiday and were quite happy. The view was amazing and we loved watching the gondola pass by under our windows. The staff were all great and gave us some great recommendations for dinner and breakfast which were very close by. The location was fantastic. All in all we loved the whole experience. We caught a water taxi to the airport which again I would highly recommend. The hotel arranged it for us. I didn't see the other rooms but all I can say is that the experience we had, exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: radboard
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and had very nice views of the canals. The service and staff were helpful with directions, tips, & maps. what really sets this place out is the location. I thought the Rialto Bridge would be the place to stay, glad I stayed here because the bridge is a zoo of people and you can't move. This place is so close to Rialto and St. Marks yet tucked just a little off, just enough to be perfect. Great place, you can't go wrong with it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo028
Reviews.Content: This is an apartment type hotel. Our room had a seperate bedroom with a sitting area that had a fold out sofa. It also had a small kitchen and refrigerator. There were 4 adults staying here and we had no problems. Both the sofa bed and the regular bed was fine. and the room has air conditioning. The location is great, about 5-10 mins from San Marco square, right on a canal. It is a little tricky to find the first time, but follow the map and just make sure you cross in front of the bank when you cross over the Goldoni Bridge. The service provided by the staff is excellent. They were very helpful in providing directions, information and places to eat. Breakfast is not included, but there are several bakeries very close that have fantastic baked goods. We will definately stay here again when we come back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen any better”
Reviews.Author: SJamesP
Reviews.Content: Apartment was very clean, spacious and relaxing. Much more than we had expected. Staff were very helpful in suggesting the best places to eat. Location was perfect for all the major attractions and a few mins walk to St. Marks Square but away from all the noise. Would definately recommend to anyone. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mjm7919
Reviews.Content: While passing through Venice, we spent the night at Residence Corte Grimani and couldn't be happier. The apartment we rented was very clean, large and slept six people with a full kitchen and 2 full bathrooms. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and accomodating and provided great recommendations in the area. Besides the staff, the location of this hotel is the selling point. Its right in the middle of town and offers balcony views of the city including gondolas passing right by. I would definitely recommend staying here especially if you are part of a larger group.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Onemorecritic
Reviews.Content: I have given Casa Grimani full marks overall. But nevertheless i shall write a balance review for the benefit of prospective travellers to Venice. The hotel is ubicated centrally less than four minutes walk from Saint marks square. This location as you can imagine is very convenient for sightseeing and also it is near the stops for water buses. The hotel is off the main street in a quiet cul de sac adjacent to a canal. Some previous reviewers have complained about the noise from a church bell. I heard the bells at about 8 am in only one out of a four day stay, but please remember that Venice is full of churches and you are likely to encounter this particular sound in many other locations too. On arrival to the hotel we were met by Franca who is one of the five concierges at the hotel. She was friendly and very welcoming providing us with tourist information when asked. The other three concierges i met were all equally helpful, friendly and very professional. The rooms were clean and towels changed daily. The reception area was small but on the other hand there was one free internet equipment available for the use of guests. The beds were comfortable and there was free use of a fridge, a kettle, microwave, two cups, two glasses and cutlery for two. We ate out in restaurants and cafes, but I can see people complaining about having to pay 50 euros for unlocking the cupboard with cooking utensils, another 50 euros to pay for the cleaning of the kitchen at the end of the stay, and 20 euros for the use of a washing machine. People who rent an apartment expect those facilities to be included in the price otherwise they would have chosen instead to stay in a hotel room. I would suggest that the hotel management increases daily charges for everyone independently of wether they cook or not and then get rid of those additional charges and make it all inclusive in one single price. In that way everybody will be happy. In summary it was a very pleasant experience staying at this aparthotel. For the price one pays i think it is excellent value for money and one should not expect or demand more than what you pay for. I shall definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment in the right point on the city map”
Reviews.Author: alexr0
Reviews.Content: Very good location - it is like 200m from Piazza San Marco (if not less). Fantastic advantage: it is on the corner of the canal where gondola route usually starts. As aresult we woke up at morning because of singing gondoliers! Moreover, once we saw by our own eyes traffic jam consists of gondolas! Plenty of restaurants/shopping nearby. 7-8 minutes by feet to Rialto bridge. Appartments itself are large, spotless clean. Good furniture and bathroom equipment. The staff is well trained and conducts fluent English. This place is for those who can adopt the idea that an apartment in Venice is absolutely not a cheap substitute to the hotel - rather it is a different feeling. It is like you live in Venice, not stay there. Apparently on the level Corte Grimany offers it is not cheap (not so expensive though, thinking that they have rooms for 2,4 and 6 persons accomodation). We (family with a kid of 12) did not find any reason to complain while staying in Corte Grimani.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sleeps 5, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Richard10024
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor. It was an excellent location to walk around venice. The room was apartment-like so it had 3 beds in 3 rooms with sleepling for 5. The use of the fridge and glasses was included. If you need the kitchen or laundry they charge extra - but they are very clear about what is and is not included. They were very nice about leaving bags and using the lobby during the day we checked out. Their recommendations for restaurants were excellent. Its not cheap - but its a great location less than 10 minutes from the Rialto and the Piazza San Marco

Reviews.Title: “Best location - the highlight of our trip to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: CJK50
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the highlight of our trip to northern Italy! Our group of 5 stayed in a "superior apartment" with 2 very large rooms, 2 bathrooms, and full kitchen. The best part was windows that overlooked small canal which is used by gondoliers. We were resting in afternoon, and heard a tenor singing with accordian music, from 2 gondola tours going past - the perfect Venice experience!! Location just minutes away from San Marco, and very convenient for all walking to sights. We took private water taxi from train station (at cost of 80 Euro) which delivered us directly to front steps of the hotel. I highly recommend that option, as comparable cost on vaporetto, for 5 people plus 5 large suitcases, would have been 65 Euro, and then the challenge of walking through narrow streets pulling bags, trying to find the hotel. Once there, we had no trouble finding it again after our touring. The staff at front desk was very helpful and made us so comfortable. We would choose this hotel again in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hidden gem, Apartment style rooms”
Reviews.Author: bucketlistshr
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path which made it a little difficult to find but it is quiet and that is good. Helpful staff with good english, close to san marco, and rialto. A lot of specialty shopping and good restaurants nearby. rooms are large with frig, tele, living rooms. The rooms are like apartments and can house a lot of people. Economical for large groups and if you stay long there is a full kitchen (you pay 60 euro extra if you use it). No need to ride gondola to hotel (110 euro). That is a waste of money, just walk from rialto or san marco square. no restaurant, but hotel across the walkway has a great brunch to get you started in the am.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 57_Mercator
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended on all counts. Our family of 4 stayed at the Gramani for 4 nights and it was great. Staff was exceptionally warm and helpful. Great location. Only glitch was that we could never figure out washer dryer combination. (We were told many Amercians have this problem!) You don't need to take a water taxi...just follow directions provided by the hotel and you will find it. Our room on the 4th floor had a great view; I suspect rooms on lower floors don't have the view, so try to get 4th or 5th floor. Free wifi was another plus. I'm sure you could get a cheaper place, but this was worth every euro. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Like most of Venice Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Cookster56
Reviews.Content: No complaints here. Great location and easy walking to S Marco Sq and Canal. After 3 days in Venice. Think 3 nights in Lodi and trips on Water Bus to S Marco and other sites would have been better option for us. Hotel was great though. Everything you would expect. Water taxi to front door was best way to get heavy backpack to door. Difficult to find in all allies and laneways/streets. All look the same after a while.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, perfect location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugSurrey_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 2 children aged 7 and 10 for a 6 day city break. The hotel was tucked away and I doubt we would have found it if we hadn't arrived by water taxi (110 euros!!). The staff were all so polite, helpful and always available, they recommended nice local restaurants when we were all hungry and tired and needed something quick and easy. We stayed in a superior apartment which was truly vast, I was expecting it to be spacious but it was huge! Fantastic for us all to relax and get away from the heat and crowds when we needed to. The apartment was aircondtitioned, very comfortable, big beds and plenty of cupboard space. We didn't use the kitchen (an extra 50 euros for cleaning) but did use the washing machine (extra 15 euros). My only gripe is the lack of breakfast, I guess this is because there are kitchens in the apartments and people self cater but for us it would have made our stay perfect rather than dragging 2 hungry kids out in search of food in the mornings! Overall a truly wonderful place to stay, I would go back in a heartbeat and hope I will someday soon, Venice is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip in a stunning Hotel Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Thefiveyeargang
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice several times now and always stayed in normal hotels, but on this trip we opted to stay in this fantastic apartment, not 70m from San Marco's square, wonderful staff, clean, easy to find, and to go to all the sites and shops. We would highly recommend this Hotel Apartment for business and tourists. Stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious apartment in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: JFC64
Reviews.Content: This building houses beautiful, quiet, clean, spacious apartments in a fabulous location several minutes walk from St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge. The residence is very quiet, located on a small canal. The front desk staff was helpful with directions and recommendations. I would say that the rate was a bit more expensive than I like to spend, but the separate rooms for us was worth it after 10 days of traveling and staying in one room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Kaliescu
Reviews.Content: We went on a 3 week Italy trip for our honeymoon, and Venice was our last stop, and our favorite! The Corte Grimani staff found out that it was our honeymoon, and when we left the room for a few hours to go sightseeing, they left a bottle of champagne and strawberries in our room! Every morning you get a continental breakfast that includes the best WARM apple fritter ever! The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. This was the only hotel in Italy that actually had king size beds, in lieu of 2 doubles pushed together. I can't say enough about the location, the Corte Grimani is literally in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Foot steps from St Mark Square, what a find”
Reviews.Author: FromAuw
Reviews.Content: To summarize, you stay in RCG for its location, good value and confortable rooms. It is less than a five-minute walk to St. Mark Square and 10~15Â´ to the Rialto bridge. The first trip to the hotel from the Rialto Bridge (where you leave the vaporetto coming from the train station) can be confusing, so you really need to concentrate in the map provided by the hotel. But once you get used to the streets, you will realize that despite its central location, it is situated in a very quiet corner of Veneza, a real plus. In the way to the St. Mark Square, there is a gondola "night parking lot". The room was very confortable for our family of four, with a door separating our bedroom from the kidsÂ´. We stayed at the top floor, with a beautiful view of the clay colored roof tops of the surrounding buildings, including the Palazzo del Bovolo spiral staircase (one of VeniceÂ´s hidden gems) and the tower of the Santa Maria Gloriosa del Piari church. Room amenities included a kitchenette (usage of microwave oven for a charge, though). The hotel does not serve breakfast, so we used to buy some sandwiches and snacks in the nearby shops and eat at the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Partyoffive-2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on April 8th and April9th 2010. We arrived by car, and were able to park at the Tronchetto, we then proceeded to take the Vaporetto and we got off at St. Marco. It took us a while to find the hotel; but once we got there it was fabulous. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. We traveled with 2 teenage girls, age 17 and 15 and our son who is 10. The hotel is so close to Piazza St. Marco and the Rialto bridge. We proceeded to explore the entire city for the next two days. The hotel manager recommended a wonderful coffee shop about 2 minutes away. The cappucino was amazing and the pastries were fresh. The price was also reasonable. We rented the 2 room apartment with view, but were upgraded to the superior upon arrival. This was nice because it meant two bathrooms instead of one. A very nice thing to have when you have two teenage girls who want to look their best in Italy! All in all we would stay at the Corte Grimani again. The vaporetto cost us 6.50 EUR per person, the water taxi would have cost maybe 50 to 75 EUR. It may have been worth it to take that and be taken right to the doorstep of the hotel. We would have saved a little aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler1946
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a hotel on Hotels.com and were appalled by how awful our experience was. I met a British couple on a vaporetto who told me about the Corte Grimani and we were able to escape Ca del Borgo (an AWFUL experience) and relocate in the San Marco region in Venice proper. Nice staff, spacious accommodations, and reasonably priced rooms. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “A”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: The Corte Grimani offers comfortable, spacious, clean & practical accommodation in the heart of San Marco for a good price. We found the reception staff - particularly the people on the day shift - very helpful & charming. Our apartment with roof top views had a great view of the Baldini staircase & was unexpectedly quiet. It's not gorgeous or designer led but it worked very well for us - particularly having a kitchenette, a washing machine & an iron & ironing board - useful when you're away a while. I suspect that it works well for most people & certainly the other guests we ran across seemed pleased to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: HRHQE
Reviews.Content: Don't think there could be a better location. Close enough to everything (within minutes) but yet tucked away enough not to be exposed to the volume of Venice. The staff was extraordinarily helpful with directions, dining, taxi arrangements, etc. The room itself was very clean. The beds were a tad hard for our tastes, but as we soon discovered, Italians seem to enjoy a firm mattress. Would definitely recommened.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern spacious family suites”
Reviews.Author: fordstreet
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find the first time, but great location. Very helpful and gracious staff. The largest family suite has a king size bed and a pull out couch in a bedroom, and then there is also a pull out couach in LR. 2 BR

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: burls1
Reviews.Content: Located a few steps to St. Marks Square, in the heart of the most beautiful section of Venice. The staff was exceptionally helpful with transportation, restaurants, and sight seeing recommendations, The room was extremely large and had a nice view. The windows opened up to a secondary canal. We were able to enjoy the boat traffic and catch a water taxi right in front of the hotel. The main gondola hub was a short walk away; as was a traghetto stop to cross the grand canal. All-in-all it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Corte Griman - Good location, service and staff”
Reviews.Author: chaitz_2000
Reviews.Content: We spent two days, the rooms are immaculately clean, the location is just perfect, close to grand canal, san marco piazza, and rialto bridge. the staff is always there for help, they offered good suggestions to dine out, places to visit, they got the glass factory guys pick us from the hotel for a demo of the factory. overall a good place to spend at. the plus is also that the there are plenty of restaurants around the hotel, gondola's starting point, good coffee bars including hardrock cafe. they have a small kitchenet, but one needs to pay 50 euro's to use the utensils, (they say its for cleaning the stuff) which we thought was an added price to the already premium rate we are paying. otherwise we can still use the heater stove and coffee maker, the cutlery, which they did charge for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JimD2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at Residence Corte Grimani and were absolutely pleased. The apartment was large, well furnished( updated), clean and comfortable. The staff( on site full time) was very helpful. The location is very close to San Marco square (4-5 minutes walk) and about 8=10 minute walk to the Rialto bridge. Very close to Canal stops and upscale shopping. Overall a great find for anybody that wants to stay close to San Marco. ( Note that use of the kitchen facilities and washer may entail another $50 per stay fee that may not be apparent when first browsed.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large apartment”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneA_t
Reviews.Content: Extremely well located - literally only a few minutes walk to either San Marco or Rialto. A large apartment with a full kitchen and washing machine/clothes dryer (some extra cost if you used the cooking appliances and dishwasher - fridge and tea/coffee facilities are complimentary). Separate lounge and dining area. Very helpful staff who spoke excellent english.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous location and roomy”
Reviews.Author: Lanky3
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful city with plenty to see and I would recommend late September after the tourist influx has peaked. We stayed 3 nights at Residence Corte Grimani, San Marco, with its own landing on a canal and would have happily stayed longer as this was a great location. We were very fortunate to see the Regatta Storica , the great parade of pageantry down the Grand Canal. It is thoroughly recommended to anyone planning a Venice trip around September. We self catered after the first day which was great as we found this to be a much better alternative to searching for a cafÃ© or restaurant that wasnâ€™t overpriced or overcrowded. The upper floor rooms are the way to go at Residence Grimani and the staff is very helpful. And make sure you get out to the local shops for food and wine. Apart from walking, vaparettos are a terrific way to go around although not if you want to see lights at night. There are limited places where you can see lights at night and the suitable spaces in vaporettos seem taken early. We were thankful we took Trip Advisor advice that if you are coming from the rail station with a lot of luggage to Venice, then a water taxi is a sound investment .Even if they are expensive(always check the price before boarding).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful residence in Venice - upper floor rooms are amazing”
Reviews.Author: TMDoc33
Reviews.Content: A lovely, clean hotel with spacious apartment-like rooms in a great location in a magical city. Friendly and helpful staff. No restaurant, but you will enjoy the many cafe's, bakeries, and restaurants nearby as well as buying food at Rialto and eating/cooking in-room. Our initial lower floor room was nice, but had a somewhat restricted view. We switched to an upper (top) floor room and the panoramic / multiple exposure views of the city were wonderful. A terrific home base in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UKGeordie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location couldn't be better, 2 mins from St Marks and 5 mins from Rialto Bridge. Takes a bit of finding, near to the Hard Rock Cafe and the gondola station. Rooms spacious, quiet and clean. Friendly staff, very helpful. Only problem was the foyer and lift get a bit smelly from the nearby canal in the evening, but, not a major issue overall. Will definitely stay here again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location when you find it - Large rooms..”
Reviews.Author: Yeadonite
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was nice but it took a very long time to find it even after telling them I was traveling with an older person and needed good directions. When I walked in they said can I help you as if I didn't belong in the hotel. I needed a bag of ice one night and it seemed like an inconvenience to them. The room was huge! A small library on the first floor. Extra charge to use the kitchen. The location s amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Eccellente!”
Reviews.Author: architett0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an outstanding stay at the Residence Corte Grimani. This hotel couldn't be better located. A couple of hundred yards from Piazza San Marco but without the noise and the traffic. It is also very close to Campo S. Luca, La Fenice and the Rialto bridge.
