The building is kept very well both inside and out. By Venice standards the rooms/suites are very large with a vestibule, living/dining area, impeccable bathroom and a large bedroom. All with nice size windows. The interiors are modern-traditional, not overdone. Our room had a kitchen that could be fully activated for an additional fee. However we only needed the refrigerator, the sink and utensils which are part of the basic rate. It even has an all-in-one washer/dryer appliance. A wonder of Italian engineering...well, maybe! The staff: Donatella, Franca, Guido and Maurizio are very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend it... but please don't tell anybody else! Did I mention they provide free internet?

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part Was the People”
Reviews.Author: Kellie-AZ
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Residence Corte Grimani. The hotel was located right in the heart of Venice, extremely convenient, but yet tucked away into a quiet little nook. The apartment was large and clean with all the necessary elements to make a comfortable stay. But the BIG selling point to the Residence Corte Grimani are the people. Every single person we met at the hotel, no matter what the time of day or job, was pleasant, helpful, smiling, and seemed to genuinely want to help us have the best time in Venice possible. No matter what our need, it was met quickly and with a smile. If you are looking for a hotel that makes you feel welcome, then the Residence Corte Grimani is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Grimani's staff made our trip to Venice one to remember”
Reviews.Author: spqr67
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Venice, we weren't sure what to expect. Our decision to stay at the Grimani was based heavily on the reviews on this site. As you can see, the vast majority of the reviews are very favorable. Ours is no exception. Navigating through Venice can be challenging, especially for those of us accustomed to hopping in a taxi and arriving at the front door of your destination. The staff of the Grimani provided us with step by step directions that were spot on. Once there, we were very impressed with the professionalism and service of the hotel's staff. The rooms are very nice and can accommodate a lengthy stay. The hotel's location is fantastic! Right on a canal but off the main walkways, so it's very quiet. We were provided many options for dining as well as proposed sites to visit by the staff. All recommendations turned out to be great (you have to try "A Beccafico"). They really know their stuff. If you've got some down time, spend a bit learning some basic Italian (we left a book in the hotel's library). It seems to go a long way with the locals (and it's quite a bit of fun). All in all, the Grimani is "molte bene!" Ciao to Guido! Michael & Kellie Arizona, USA PS. If you can swing it, take a private water taxi to/from the hotel. Makes for a MUCH easier time getting to and from. Be warned...100 euro each way.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for honeymooners!!”
Reviews.Author: zoro99
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at corte grimani, the staff were very nice, rooms were spacious and clean, it is very romantic in general, we will definetly go there again it was a bit difficult to find the hotel though when we first arrived to st luca given that the numbers in the street were completely random.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family, will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ARZJ
Reviews.Content: Very clean, spacious rooms with kitchen. Great location - close to San Marco but quiet. Bathroom was spotless. Friendly and accommodating staff -- we loved all the restaurants they recommended . They even provided a high chair and "pack and play" for my 22 month old.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Keuka431
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Superior Room" with our two girls (9 & 11). Considering how expensive Venice was, I was very pleasantly surprised at how much room we got for the cost. The rooms were large and well appointed. The location was perfect, just minutes walk to Rialto Bridge or St. Marks. If we return to Venice, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JMV59
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here in July 2009 and just loved it. When we arrived, Guido at the front desk was so nice and hospitable. He made us feel very welcome. The 2 rooms could sleep 6 very comfortably. It had 2 bathrooms and included a small kitchen area. The rooms were very clean and the air conditioning worked very well - it was needed as the temperatures reached the high 80s. The location of the hotel was perfect - just a couple of minutes from Saint Mark Square. Would definitely stay here again! Multo bello!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to in Venice”
Reviews.Author: liduk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April with husband and 2 girls so I'm a bit late writing this review. This "apartment" was perfect for us with 2 bathrooms. It is very central, spotlessly clean, large, and modern. Very helpful front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Large Apartment in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LinaToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Superior Apartment, which consisted of a living/ dining /kitchen area, a very large master bedroom with bathroom, and a second bathroom with walk in closet. The positives: The apartment was large, simply decorated and very clean. We asked for (and paid for) a room with a canal view and it was worth it. Free internet connection in the room. Very comfortable beds. Great bathrooms with good water pressure. When booking directly with the hotel I mentioned we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and when we checked in to the room there was a bottle of Proseco waiting for us- nice touch! There is a lobby with a front desk attendant who was extremely helpful. Also a sitting area with a library of travel books on Italy and Venice- that could be borrowed. GREAT LOCATION- just mere steps from SanMarco Piazza one way and Rialto Bridge the other way. Washer and Dryer in room for an additional 15 Euros- TOTALLY worth it! Negatives The bedding is still the oldfashioned bedspread. They need to upgrade to a duvet or blanket- no one likes to cover themselves with those old fashioned bedspreads . Breakfast not available. In order to use the stove in the kitchen there is an additional 50Euro charge- which is detailed on their websie. We did not use the kitchen as we did not go to Venice for my home cooking. Note: If you take a water taxi you can get dropped off right at the foot of the hotel. We thought we were doing this- but our taxi driver dropped us off in the wrong place and we were lost. Venice is a city to get lost in!! So just don't get out of that water taxi unless you see the hotel. Overall a good place to stay if you are looking for a large, clean apartment that can easily accomodate a family of four in a great location. If you are looking for 5 star luxury- look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tplus
Reviews.Content: For me its even hard to imagine that there could be a better place to stay in Venice. Highly recommended! I'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city..”
Reviews.Author: Pewts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days for our first anniversary, arriving by water taxi (expensive but worth it - â‚¬110ish) and took us straight to the door of the hotel. Very helpful in a place like Venice! As we got there early, our room wasn't ready but the staff were very helpful and locked our cases in a room while we explored the city. The room was much more than we expected - a separate bedroom and living area and very spacious. The room was cleaned with new towels every day. The location was great, only 5 minutes from San Marco's Square in one direction and the Rialto Bridge in the other. It was tucked away and not noisy at all. We'd recommend getting the 72hr vaporetto (water bus) pass - your feet will hurt if you walk everywhere! We pre-booked the Doge's Palace Secret Itineraries tour, which was a highlight of our visit - really interesting and worth the money. Of course, we loved the gondola ride (â‚¬80). We didn't enjoy our short stay in Harry's Bar (â‚¬20 for a cocktail!) We'd recommend visiting this time of the year - the weather was just right and this hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - one minor quip”
Reviews.Author: Grangebellew
Reviews.Content: We booked into Residence Corte Grimani after a two week stay in Marina di Venezia. We were immediately pleased with the apartment as it was spacious and clean with great views of the canals below (we paid extra for the view). The only minor quip would be that when we pay for an apartment we expect full kitchen facilities to be included whether or not we choose to use them or not. It's really mean lock dishes away to expect guests to pay â‚¬50 extra for the use of a microwave. For our visit we planned to eat out. As the microwave was located at waist level, just the perfect height for our three year old to access we took the trays out. When we had an issue with our kettle the receptionist visited our apartment he informed us that he would be adding â‚¬50 to our bill because it looked like we were using the microwave. We objected to this and he didn't but it at â‚¬230 a night we expect more. Besides this we found the stay pleasant and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another good hotel found via TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: AnneBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights during Easter at Residence Corte Grimani. We picked the apartment hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews. Yet again, we made a good choice. Arrival and departure We came from Milan with train to Venezia. From the train station we hopped on vaporetto no 1, hopping off at Rialto bridge. From there we followed the hotel's directions (see their homepage) and the hotel was easy to find. It was a few minutes walk, and not too bad with two big suitcases, as the narrow streets are really lovely to walk along. Upon departure, we took the water taxi from front of the hotel, going directly to the airport of Venezia, at the price of 100â‚¬ in total. The hotel and the room The hotel is perfectly located. You find everything you need nearby. The gondolas are just over the bridge, a minutes walk; there are many clothing stores just around the corner (Armani, CK, Guess, Puma); as are restaurants (from Italian ones, to chains such as Hard Rock Cafe, Hell's Kitchen, Burger King...); and also a lot of historic sightseeing as well as boats leaving for nearby islands. The walls are rather thin though in the building, as also commented by the other reviewers. Thus we went for a room on the top floor (room 503), facing windows to the west (not facing the Goldoni bridge). This didn't bother us at all, as we usually came to the room around six o'clock, just in time to open all the windows, enjoy the beautiful sun, whilst drinking a cold glass of prosecco or beer. After sunset we headed back on the streets again, to go for dinner. The rooms were spacious, and very clean. Beds were typical Italian (read: quite hard). We had no issues with running warm water (as some other reviewers had mentioned), and we showered both mornings and evenings. Restaurants The first evening we went to a place recommended by the hotel owner. It was called Aciughetta. He recommended a few others also, but as this wasn't to our satisfaction, we never tried out the other ones (saw them from outside though, and chose not to go in). You got very basic food, one portion for each and one beer and one water for 39â‚¬. Additionally the portions weren't even tasty. We don't recommend this place. We also tried to have dinner at San Trovaso, as recommended by many reviewers, but the queues were extreme. There is a reason why everybody tells you to reserve a table in advance :) Unfortunately we didn't have the opportunity to check this place out. We had dinner twice along the Grande Canal, by Rialto Bridge. Yes, a typical "touristic scene", where it is nice to see people walking by; the food, however, is not much to cheer for. You get two basic spaghettis, two glasses of house wine and one coffee for about 50 â‚¬. The list prices usually don't include the "servizio", which is + 12% on top of list prices. Usually I love Italian food, and therefore the only disappointment on this trip was the cuisine. However, I assume Venezia is quite a tourist trap, so you really need to find the local, small restaurant gems, to get the typical tasty Italian food. We did find two very good restaurants though. One was on the island Burano, and the other on Lido (along Gran Valle Santa Maria Elisabeta). There we had our best meals and deserts, at also reasonable prices. Unfortunately I cannot recall their names. Things to see It's easy and fun to explore the streets of Venezia. My husband isn't much of a walker, but even he liked walking here, down the narrow streets, of which corner you always find something new and fascinating. Try to see as much as possible, from walks along Fondamenta Zattere allo Spirito Santo, to smaller silent streets of Cannaregio. If you want to see something outside Venezia also, we recommend Burano. It was so colourful, peaceful, cosy, with small houses and restaurants. You also find all the same souveniers here and groceries to get back home, but remarkably cheaper. Then we also recommend Lido for a stroll. You can also rent a bike, and bicycle the island from one end to the other (approx. 12 km). Bicycle rent is 7 â‚¬ per hour. To go to these places, or in general moving around with the vaporettos in Venezia, we recommend buying the "boat card". E.g. a 72 hour boat card was 33 â‚¬. You can use them on all the boats, hop on and off, whenever and wherever you wish - very practical. These can be used also on boats to Lido, Burano, Murano... If you decide to go further away, you have car rentals at Piazzale Roma. Breakfast and snacks The only thing Corte Grimani didn't provide for, was breakfast (or other restaurant offerings). You can have breakfast at the hotel on the opposite side, at the price of 18â‚¬. We decided though to buy the food we wanted from markets/ stores, and enjoyed them in the room, before heading on our adventures every morning. What most reviewers had written, was that it is difficult to find a store. We found several though, and here is the one we used three times: You can walk, or take vaporetto 1 from Rialto, two stops to Ca' D'Oro. You hop off, walk along Calle Ca' D'Oro, and then take Strada Nova to the left, walk over the bridge, and you'll find Billa on the right hand side. Instead of taking the vaporetto, you can also walk "along" the Grande Canal passing Rialto, coming over to Cannaregio. There was also one Billa when coming to Lido, on the left hand side, in the beginning of Gran Valle Santa Maria Elisabeta. From the hotel you can also buy drinks at good prices. Examples: 1,5 litre water for 1,50â‚¬, 1 litre juice for 2â‚¬, 33cl beer for 1,50â‚¬, 33cl Coca-Cola for 1,50â‚¬, and 75cl wine bottles for 8, 10, 12 or 16â‚¬. Summary We loved visiting Venezia, but so far, no trip has beaten our trip to Cinque Terre some years ago. Venezia was nice for an extended city-weekend, strolling around the streets, watching people, old architecture and listening to performers on Piazza San Marco in the evenings. Know, however, that the streets get quite silent after ten-eleven in the evenings. Some areas have pubs, like around Calle Aquila Nera, Calle Galeazza and Calle Stagneri. The only downside of our trip was our restaurant experiences, but otherwise we had a lovely trip, and the apartment hotel met our expectations. Wishing you a pleasant stay in Venezia and Corte Grimani!

Reviews.Title: “Wedded Bliss”
Reviews.Author: WilliamOnTheFylde
Reviews.Content: Well, I arrived here with my fiance and our 2 9 year old children on 23/5/09. We flew from Liverpool to Treviso airport and caught the bus to the main terminal then the vaporetto to the Rialto Bridge stop. It's worthwhile visiting the hotel's website and printing off their map and directions although it wasn't too difficult to find. From the Rialto stop there are a couple of bridges to negotiate, not so easy with cases and kids but it it's only 5 minutes away. We arrived at the hotel in blazing sunshine and entered the cool air conditioned reception where we were cheerfully greeted and expected on announcing our name. After the formalities we were shown to our 1st floor, 2 bedroomed apartment (101) by lift and our cases were brought up minutes later. The air conditioning had been switched on in advance of our arrival and was sheer bliss after the heat of the journey. And what a room! The main room had a large window with Juliette balcony overlooking a narrow canal, beautiful wooden furnitute, TV, small kitchen area and large fridge as well as it's own bathroom. The main bedroom was large and airy with a double bed plus double sofa bed, elegant furniture and another en suite bathroom. It was beautifull. As we were getting married, we decided to have the smaller room with the balcony and let the kids have the other room. There was plenty of wardrobe and cupboard space along with 2 safes (one with a combination lock, the other a key). The kitchen utensils were locked up (except for the fridge) and could be used for an additional charge of â‚¬50. The location of the hotel is perfect, overlooking a canal and being in the middle of the San Marco district just 5 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge to the north and 5 minutes from St Marks Square to the south. The hotel staff were informative and helpfull in every respect, offering advice on the vaporetto, directions and restaurants. There was free internet access in the lobby and a library of guide books and maps available. The receptionist and night porter were happy to bring drinks to the room at excellent prices - â‚¬1.50 for a can of beer and â‚¬8.00 for a good bottle of wine - very good prices for a hotel. At night we sat in the open window overlooking the canal as the night-time gonoliers drifted silently by with just the occasional cry of "oyi" breaking the silence. On the 25th May Carolyn and I married in the town hall on what was a magical day. We will never forget our wonderful experience in Venice and the contribution this outstanding apartment made to our trip. Belissimo!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem near St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: JosephToronto
Reviews.Content: We (a group of four from Toronto, Canada) spent four days in Venice in late May before our Greek Isles cruise. Initially, I did not consider Residence Corte Grimani because â‚¬280 per room for two rooms would be a bit pricy. Then I read one of the reviews mentioning that some of the units in Grimani could comfortably accommodate four. So I booked an apartment unit with an extra room (which cost an additional â‚¬30 for three nights). We were all thoroughly pleased with my selection: great location, spacious apartment by all standards, spotlessly clean, extremely affordable (for four). We took a water taxi from the Marco Polo Airport, so we have no problem finding the place. The water taxi ride, though a bit expensive, was a real experience. Besides, it went right to the door step of Grimani. I felt that it was a bargain when I saw people dragging their luggage in the narrow uneven streets of Venice. We had been to Venice twice before with some tour group. This time, we spent four days here on our own. It was a truly wonderful experience. Staying at Grimani has made a big difference. It allowed us to explore Venice till late at night. Moreover, an afternoon nap back in the hotel helped tremendously. I will highly recommend Grimani and we will definitely use it the next time we are in Venice. - Joseph from Toronto P.S. Here is some useful tips for someone using a GPS device after Venice. I got a new Garmin GPS device for a driving trip to the Hill Towns region (Marostica, Bassano del Grappa), north of Venice after our Venice stay and cruise. When I used the unit, it went haywired on me (telling me to turn into a one-way street with opposite traffic, not warning me before a turn, telling me to turn left on a highway). It was only after we returned to Toronto that I realized why. I turned the GPS unit to "Pedestrian" mode when I was in Venice. Then I turned the power off to save battery life. But I forgot to reset it back to the "Car" mode. Everything made sense afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CarolFlorida69
Reviews.Content: Convenient to St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge, both with water bus transportation to anywhere in Venice. Large rooms and use of refrigerator and microwave--kitchen cooking facilities 50 euros extra. We had 5th floor overlooking rooftops--very quiet. Water taxi to airport will cost 110 euros. We took a water bus at Rialto Bridge for 13 euros each. Easy 10 min. walk to Rialto Bridge from hotel and 8-10 min. walk to airport from waterway where all boats leave you off. We are 69 and 70 and found it to be quite easy. Just be sure to take the Orange water bus (it has an orange emblem and only makes 2 stops). The one at St. Mark's will make a lot more stops but does the same thing. The people at the ticket booths are quite helpful. Water taxi and water bus are 2 different forms of water transportation. Water buses are inexpensive and your main mode of transportation. 6,50 euros 1 way or you can purchase a unlimited 12 hr., 24 hr, 36 hr or 7 day pass. Hotel gives you a map of Venice which was extremely helpful and all the staff will help you with any questions. There is no food at the hotel, but there are more than enough places to eat at all price ranges with St. Marks being the highest price. Ask at the desk they will tell you where to find everything on the map--bakery, fruit market, meat, dairy or whatever. By the way, St. Marks Square is overrun with people, people, people. By all means, visit other parts of Venice which are very charming. The open air market at Railto Bridge is very interesting with everything to buy. Even if you don't cook at the apartment (which we didn't) buy a couple pieces of fruit--very fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot”
Reviews.Author: bill54321
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in the heart of Venice. Large extremely clean and modern rooms - we had a family of 5 in 1 unit with no problems. Go for a unit overlooking the rooftops of Venice - spectacular. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “incredible location amazing apartment beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: landr0ver
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and it was just fantastic. We picked Residence Corte Grimani on the basis of trip advisor reviews and their website. We were not disappointed! The location was incredible with a small balcony right over the canal which was on one on the main Gondaliers routes which passed by every few minutes. Chose Residence Corte Grimani if like us you want to be independant. This is a luxury apartment not a luxury hotel- there is a basic basement area for breakfast- and a small comfortable lobby. There is a Â£50 euro charge for unlocking cooking facilities but you can just use the fridge and sink free if you are eating out. We just loved having our meals overlooking the canal and watching people pass by over Goldoni Bridge and listening to the gondaliers singing. Plenty of small local shops selling all the provisions you need. Ideally placed midway bewteen Rialto and St Marks. 5 mins beautiful iwalk to either. Our Superior apartment had a very large lounge with dining table, sofa bed and kitchen area and bathroom. The second very large room had double bed sofa bed and independant bathroom. All very clean and to a high standard. It was hot in July but the apartment was very cool. Tip Be aware some streets are very narrow and cobbled. Dont come laden with suitcases. There are no taxis here other than expensive water taxis. A gondala ride is a must -unforgetable- Go from St marks Sq and you pass the Palace, bridge of sighs and beautiful backwater canals. Buy a vaparetto (water bus) pass for your stay and if you have time visit the nearby islands Burano and Murano. Venice is very busy by day but much quieter at night. Wandering through the sidetreets is a pleasure. ou never know whats round the next corner- we came across a Ferrari shop complete with an FI car!! dont ask me how they got it there! Venice - We loved it, the children loved it - what more can i say! Some people have said hard to find but if you directions no problem! From Piazzale Roma take Vaporetto number 2 to Rialto Bridge. As you get off turn right along the Grand Canal . Go along Riva del Ferro going by the portico of the palace on the Grand Canal. Cross the bridge and take the first street on your left (Calle Bembo); at the end of the street turn right on Calle del Teatro and then on your left until you reach Campo San Luca. From here take Calle Goldoni just in front. Go by boutique Armani and continue until Goldoni Bridge. Having reached the bridge look to your right and you will see Corte Grimani!! Take a few steps back and take narrow marble catwalk down the side of the bank that brings you to the Residence.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel in an unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: Warren34
Reviews.Content: The team at Corte Grimani have created and maintained an enjoyable and unforgettable experience. Maurizio the evening manager was fantastic even though we checked in late and tired with two children. He directed us to the best dining spots suitable for a young family with nice Venice style food (not tourist trap stuff). Catching a water taxi to or from the hotel doorstep was a magical experience and worth the extra Euros. The rooms are fantastic in size and standard. The hotel was very quiet but still central to San Marco square/ Rialto Bridge. This has really changed our experience of accomodation in Venice and certainly lifted the standard. Warren Lee and family Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “perfect !”
Reviews.Author: 7i150
Reviews.Content: For us it's the perfect hotel, well situated in the center of Venise between Rialto and San Marco. Very quiet, very large rooms (rare in Venise !), very clean (and we are not people who say that easily) and not too expensive. For some people who would like breakfast (what a mistake in this city, as there are so many places to have a fantastic one), who would like to be in a busy hotel with crowd, with activities, with bar, with disco, with fitness room... it's not for them ! If you are looking for something clean, quite, spacious, well situated, just to sleep well and have all the day to visit Venise, it's for you !!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly lovely place to stay. The staff is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: MaryW49
Reviews.Content: Just back from my second stay at the Corte Grimani. Our first stay was 2 years ago and the place was newish and had not yet been discovered by so many. It is still the perfect place to spend your time in Venice. It was a wonderful surprise two years ago, and this year it felt like coming home. It is perfectly situated in the city; it is immaculately clean; the rooms are spacious and well thought out; you can use the teapot and sink and refrigerator for coffee and tea and breakfast, without charge; and the staff is warm and welcoming and so helpful. I can't imagine staying anywhere else and hope to see Donatella, Guido, Franca and the rest of the staff again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jasonbostoncl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night in Residence Corte Grimani and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Our first reaction to the room was wow, it's so big! There is plenty of space as the room is large and very clean. The location is perfect. It is a short walk from the Rialto bridge water bus stop and a very short walk to San Marcos! It's on a side street as well so it was very quiet. We were greeted by friendly staff and had a very nice stay. High-speed internet is also included. There is a computer in the lobby to use and also internet in the room for anyone bringing their own laptop. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff were lovely, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: JennyLH
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Venice. Stayed here with husband and two young children . The staff were very welcoming and the place was simple, modern and immaculately clean. We had a large modern apartment with three rooms and a bathroom. The location was ideal - it was about ten minutes walk from Rialto and 10 minutes from St Marks Square, but even though it was in the heart of Venice it was a haven of calm and the apartment was cool and quiet . There was a canal outside the front door where gondolas floated past.. A fantastic coffee shop round the corner served delicious lattes and pastries. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location In Venice”
Reviews.Author: Where2Next4
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the Trip Advisor reviewers, we have just returned from a great stay at the Corte Grimani. We have 2 children, and as others said, the layout of the rooms is great for families. I think it was a great value for the location in Venice. The location was great for us- about halfway between the Rialto bridge and San Marco plaza- which meant you could choose to go either way to water taxi's, shopping, etc. There is a small canal adjacent to the hotel, so there is some boat traffic nearby but not much. Also the more expensive Bonvecchiati hotel is just across the way, and there was a singer most nights- so when we opened the windows we could hear the music lightly in the distance and it was lovely. Hard Rock Cafe was also close by (if that kind of thing interests you- we didn't go in) and a Burger King was just around the corner (great for the cranky kids). The hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful. There is a computer with internet in the lobby you can use for brief periods (printing is 30 cents per page I think), and a little lobby area with tables/chairs you can sit in if necessary. We had a standard room, which was actually two rooms (one with large bed, and one with sofa bed, table, and kitchenette). It was quite clean and had no odor, tiled floors if I remember correctly. I would not describe it as plush, but it was clean and comfortable. You have to pay 50 Euro extra for the stove and microwave, 15 Euro extra if you want to use the washing machine, but we didn't need these. Use of the refrigerator was included in the room rate. One note of caution: when we arrived at the train station, we decided to take a private taxi from there to the hotel, since the public ferries were on strike that day and only running intermittently, and thinking it would be easier with the bags, etc. We discussed a price at the dock and for 70 Euro, the guy promised to take us around a little for views of the grand canal and drop us directly at the hotel. However, a different guy actually drove us there and took us only straight to the public water taxi landing at Rialto. So we had to lug our bags ourselves on the same exact path we would have taken if we had taken the public water taxi for 2 euro each. This was a complete rip off, but we had no power to negotiate at that point, because it was only after we got off the boat that I realized where he had dropped us off. The driver said the bridges by the hotel were too small for him to pass under, but this didn't seem true. I told the woman at the hotel the story because I was still funing about it, and she said they usually arrange a water taxi through a certain company to avoid this kind of problem. I would suggest contacting the hotel for that information if you are so inclined, or taking the public water taxi #2 to Rialto and walking from there to the hotel. The directions on the hotel webiste are very good and easy to follow. Overall, I would say this was an excellent location and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Venice! Location, Location, Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra2kii9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous stay at this hotel.We were very very happy. Just around the corner from Piazza San Marco, in a fantastic location and when you go into the apt there is NO NOISE!!!!!! It's lovely and quite, you would forget you are in the centre of such a busy city. We (my husband and I ) loved the space we had ,as a hotel room is just a room, this was a bedroom, a kitchen /dining room with a sofa, a bathroom, and a small room ideal for luggage, coats etc.The staff were extreemly helpfull , nothing was too much trouble for them. Overall we had a fantastic stay in venice and this hotel definately added to it, as it made everything very easy because of the location. Would stay there again without a doubt. We paid 4 star money for a crap hotel in Nice last November and this was such a refreshing change. Its probably a bit on the pricy side but worth it. We found a supermarket and bought cheese, cold meats and a bottle of persecco......food in supermarkets is cheap .Having the kitchen with table and chairs was so handy...fresh croissants and hot rolls for breakfast. Overall would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: T0mmyB
Reviews.Content: Right next to the water and about 50 feet from a large street, this unexpected paradise gave us what we wanted and more. The accomodations were excellent and the staff could not have been more helpful. Definitely a return stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for larger groups”
Reviews.Author: scsilveira
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from April 3 to 7 with my wife and son. Location is great, near Piazza San Marco, but away from crowds going to the Rialto; with windows closed, it is quiet in mid-day. Rooms are spacious and modern, with tasteful furnishings. Bathrooms are OK. Small kitchen and fairly large refrigerator included; using the oven requires an extra charge. Folks at the desk are nice and helpful, and speak English well. (Everyone in Venice seems to speak English well). Small lobby has free use of internet. Really unbeatable value if traveling as 4-5, good value if traveling as 3.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Seeker_Finder
Reviews.Content: This place was just right for our honeymoon. Operated by a very qualified staff with a professional candor, who were always available to help us at any hour. They even left a cold bottle of prosecco for us on arrival! The room was very big and had a kitchen, washer/dryer, reading room, and bedroom with plenty of closet space. This was a very pleasant and quiet place to live for the week. Located just a few short strides and a bridge away from Piazza San Marco; I really can't imagine a better location for the price. I think the room-size and location of this hotel remains the most impressive aspect of Corte Grimani. Beware of rooms with no view, as we had a room with a view of a narrow alley and construction scaffolding. If you're want an exceptional hotel that's priced well for such an expensive area- you should definitely book Corte Grimani and go enjoy this enchanting city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely apartment.”
Reviews.Author: peterrg
Reviews.Content: I was unsure of booking an apartment as in the past we have preferred having bed & breakfast in a hotel etc but I need not have worried! The location is great as it is literally only a few minutes from St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. We paid for a basic apartment as we saved the money for spending as Venice is not cheap! I have read reviews of the noise above and yes you can hear people upstairs but I have had the same problems in some hotels and we did not think it was excessive. What would would have been nice was a tea towel & washing up liquid to wash up our plates and cups (and wine glasses - none are provided). We found a supermarket about 5 minutes away but I could not tell you where it was although we found it again after stumbling across it the first time so we stocked up on bread, cheese, salami etc so we could have a continental breakfast in the morning. The apartment is lovely and spacious and it was nice to wander around without being stuck in a room like in a hotel. The apartment is spick and span and it is cleaned every morning with fresh towels. There is a TV provided although you will be limited to BBC World Service, CNN & MTV unless you can speak French, Italian or German. The service was excellent and when you arrive there is a bottle of water in the fridge and some cookies on the dining table. If you do not want to use the kitchen (which attracts a cleaning charge of 50 euros if you do) then you will be limited to using the kettle & fridge but we did not find this a problem - there are cups, saucers, plates and cutlery provided free of charge and this was good enough for us. I cannot recommend Corte Grimani high enough - the location is just fantastic and if you can find a supermarket then it will be far better than a hotel. The instructions on how to get there are ok but I woud say that when you approach the final bridge you will find a hotel on your right called the Bonchietta (or something like that) and a bank immediately on your left - turn left down the side of the bank and Corte Grimani is then right in front of you. Now for Venice - a fantastic city and we loved just wandering around and it is so easy to walk round it. We explored all the points of the compass and did not use the vaporetto although our legs knew about this as they ached!! I would use www.veniceconnected.com as we booked our return trip form on the Aligaluna line using this website and some toilet passes which saved us quite a bit - to use the public toilets will cost you 1.50 euros and we bought 10 passes for 5 euros before we went so it saved us a lot (you do have to book 15 days beforehand). This website will also save you money if you want to do any musuems and you can also book tickets for the vaporetto. St Marks Square is a womderful experience and the Rialto Bridge is just wonderful to look at. We diod not visit any museums but the buildings are an eye opener and we loved wandering the streets just window shopping and looking at places of intererest. We did not have coffee in St Marks Square but we did have afternoon tea In Caffe Florian but this is not like a traditional afternoon tea here as there were no pastries and it is served with whipped cream rather than clotted cream - still an experience just the same. What I think is better than coffee in St Marks Square is we found a restaurant in the Dorsoduro region - go to the bottom of the region and walk along the Fondamenta Zattere and head towards the end which is opposite St Marks - you will eventually come to a restaurant all on its own called Linedombra (I think) and we had a glass of wine while just watching the boats go by and taking in the view - if it is anice day you just cannot top this!!! Eating out is expensive and I would recommend a place called Trattoria Stoica (or something like that) which we found near Campo Dei Gesuiti which did a fixed price Venetian menu rather than the usual tourist menu - the food and service was just great. Go to Venice - book Residence Corte Grimani - it will be an experience you will remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: HilsEngland
Reviews.Content: Brilliant. Lets see: Fabulous location - close enough to the main Piazza to be 'in the thick of it' but far enough away to avoid the bundle of tourists. Right on a canal that the Gondoliers use for tours so we got serenaded every day. It has its own taxi stop right outside. It is scrupulously clean. The staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. There is a free internet enabled PC in the lobby for guest use. The room facilities were fabulous. Great beds, good bathrooms and a useful 'mini kitchen'. I honestly cannot think of anything negative to say. I would go again myself and would recommend it to anyone at all. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for Carnival visit, central, beautiful large rooms, accomodation would suit family with 2 or more children”
Reviews.Author: jumblemo
Reviews.Content: The photos don't quite do this hotel justice. For a European hotel, the rooms are well equipped, in tip-top condition and spacious. We stayed in a large corner suite with 2 big high ceilinged rooms, lobby, 2 bathrooms and kitchen, and it was suitable for sleeping 6 despite our booking for 4. TV and wired internet included in the room. It is only minutes from St Marks Piazza, the hub of Venice, and a good base for exploring this amazing city. At time of writing it is number 3 of over 400 hotels in Venice, and yet the price is relatively modest. I would recommend it to anyone. It does have two negatives that are worth noting: 1. During our stay the water was never quite as hot as needed for a relaxing bath - tepid at best. 2. For some reason the hotel room was poorly insulated against outside noise. Late night revellers, and delivery boat engine noise could be clearly heard despite the double glazed windows - as if the walls were as thin as a sheet of ply. Sad to say, but sensitive folks should pack earplugs. Of lesser concern was the fact that this hotel did not provide restaurant facilities. However there are plenty of local establishments and the option to use the fridge, sink and microwave even if you choose not to pay the 50 euros for use of the oven and dishwasher. Dont let the shortcomings put you off. This is a good place to stay. I would not go anywhere else in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Spacious, Felt Like Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: sun-days945
Reviews.Content: This apartment was gorgeous and felt like home away from home. We are a family of four with two parents and two grown up children in our early 20s, and it was really hard for us to find reasonably priced lodging that could accommodate all four of us without being cramped and crowded - that is, until we found Corte Grimani. The apartment is very spacious and there was plenty of room for all of us to settle in and relax. Apartment Details: We rented a Classic Apartment, which could fit up to 5 people. The first room was very spacious with a queen sized sofa bed, a dining table for four, small flat screen TV and a kitchenette with mini-fridge, microwave and sink (they also have dishes and utensils, but you have to place a 50 euro deposit with the front desk first). The master bedroom is incredibly huge with a large bed, desk, two wardrobes, safe and a sitting area. We also had a nice and clean bathroom (good water pressure) and another small room with a twin bed. The apartment is very well appointed and well taken care of. Location: Location of Corte Grimani is fantastic! We took the Viaporetto from the train station, got off at Rialto, and walked about 5 minutes to CG from there. We were careful to follow the directions on their website and had no problem at all finding it (it is tucked away on a little side path along a canal). From CG, it's less than 5 minutes to St. Mark's Square, and you're very close to many delicious restaurants (and a lot of fancy stores, if that's your thing!) As CG doesn't provide breakfast, we were able to walk to a cute little bakery (~2 minute walk) for breakfast in the mornings. Fantastic croissants. Venice: Loved it. It's very touristed but so charming. My favorite part of the city was exploring it by foot -- we loved the winding streets, narrow canals and unique architecture. We spent a lot of time exploring the different areas, not heading to anything in particular, but popping into gelato shops and small churches that caught our eye and perusing the artists selling their work in the street. Our canal tour was scenic and fun too. I'd also very heartily recommend coughing up the 8 euro to go up the clock tower at St. Mark's. An absolutely breathtaking view of Venice -- we climbed St. Peter's Basilica in Rome and went up the Duomo and to Michaelangelo's Park in Florence, and I must say the view of Venice was the most beautiful. Also, I hate to say it, but I don't think you'd be missing anything if you didn't go to single museum in Venice. The museums in Florence and Rome absolutely blew away anything we saw in Venice, and I would say that Venice is better experienced on the streets than looking at artwork. :) Overall, I thought CG was fantastic and would recommend it to anyone! It's an excellent value for the location, amenities and quality. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Nozza-22
Reviews.Content: This is a magnificent hotel. We got a room with a view of Venice's cobbled roofs. It was beautiful. Bed was so comfy even though I slept in the sofa! Flat Panel TV and Venice's Canals were right on our doorstep. Hotel has free internet access and will provide you directions of how to walk there from the famous Rialto bridge water metro station! Will welcome you at night and every morning we woke up to a freshly - made continental breakfast (optional) which we had in our private dining room with the view. An amazing hotel right in the heart of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, homely and spacious”
Reviews.Author: capap
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Residence Corte Grimani and were not disappointed. It is very spacious and cosy and lovely to return to after a day out. We were visiting with our five year old son and the extra space (as compared to a normal hotel room) was fantastic. It was very clean with good fitiings etc. Bathroom is nice and roomy. We were on the 5th floor and could see the domes of San Marco and the Bell Tower (when it was not foggy). The residence is really close to San Marco square as well as the Rialto Bridge. I would not hesitate to highly recommend this place to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MissGigl
Reviews.Content: After reading TripAdvisor reviews for this place, I was pleased to find 3 apartments available here for my group of friends. It was everything we had hoped it would be. The place is spotless, friendly, in a perfect location, great bathrooms, and the rooms are enormous. What more could you want?! Seriously, I couldn't believe the price either. My travelling buddy and I decided to share a room and were delighted to discover that our apartment has a second full bathroom and the sofabed was very comfortable. It was definitely worth the price for the upgraded room for us. We didn't use the kitchen but if we had been there longer or with kids it would have been perfect. Some of the previous reviews talked about the noise and yes, we could hear someone above us walking around a little but it wasn't bad at all. We were also in room 201 which has a view of the canal. It didn't seem terribly loud either with the windows closed. So, maybe if you are very sensitive to noise you might want to bring earplugs, but I didn't think it was a problem. Finally, the staff was helpful and cheerful -- and spoke great English. It was an all-around great experience and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: apr11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at the Residence Corte Grimani after booking based on reviews read on TripAdvisor, and I have to say we were not mislead. The staff were incredibly friendly, the hotel was immaculate, the location beautiful. We loved the room (Superior Room). Our only concern had to do with the fact that you could hear people walking and chairs being dragged on the tile floor in the room above ours. This kept us from sleeping in one morning (which we were looking forward to as this was a weekend without the kids), but once we adjusted to our neighbour's schedule, it was fine. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: xsltrvl
Reviews.Content: Staying for 5 nights, 16-21st October 2008, my wife and I and two sets of friends took three one-bed apartments at the Corte Grimani.The hotel is outstanding. Location, staff, size of rooms, facilities and relaxed atmosphere are all first class. The staff are a delight. ever friendly and ever present. The chambermaid services and cleaning is also first-class. The 'hotel' actually comprises lobby, breakfast room and small lounge and 15 one and two bed apartments, three to a floor, at prices that you would normally pay for a pokey and much less well located ensuite bedroom in a circa 3/4 star Venice hotel. The apartments are very, very spacious with a lounge/kitchen, bathroom, and bedroom(s) with masses of storage and hanging space. Beds are very large and comfroatable. The kitchen is very modern and well equiped. You can chose to use the kitchen facilities or not. We chose not to, preferring to have breakfast prepared for us and served in our apartment or going out for breakfast. The hotel does not have a restaurant and does not have top-end, 24hr on demand, five star facilties, but nor should it. Venice is an exploring city and hotels should be used to rest, sleep and occasionaly have a lzy breakfast. This is a gem of a hotel, supremely well located and a 'must-consider' for most travellers to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bax52
Reviews.Content: After finding this place on TripAdvisor we decided to book for three nights at the end of October. Booked one Classic with Room and one Superior Room. Both were absolutely fantastic. The Superior Room was massive. We had Rooms 401 and 502 and both were faultless. Great views and a great location. We wished we had booked the inbound private water taxi through the Hotel as the one we got at the airport wouldnt take us to the front door, and we had to haul our cases with the taxi driver as a guide from the Grand Canal. On departure we asked the Hotel to organise a private taxi, and this one came direct to the door. Much better. Venice is very expensive. At each end of the scale we loved Da Fiore Osteria, about 10 mins over the Rialto and very hard to find. Its a Michelin one star and will cost 140 euro per head plus wine but was outstanding. At the other end of the scale we loved the Gondoliers Bar, near the Hotel. Go out the front door and turn right over the bridge and its on your right facing the Gondola park. All the Gondoliers use it and its very cheap. By far the best value bar we found and most atmospheric too with all the locals and gondoliers in there. We also loved The San Marco Osteria near the Hotel. Excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Really Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ladyinthestreet
Reviews.Content: Corte Grimani is easier to find than you would expect, as long as you have the step by step instructions the hotel supplies you with in the confirmation emails. I was anxious beforehand because there have been some terror stories, but you need not fear. And it kind of feels like an adventure or finding lost treasure, so you'll hopefully enjoy finding it as much as we did. Once inside, the hotel has a hushed, intimate atmosphere. You almost feel like you should be whispering or someone will stumble upon your great luck and kick you out. We were greeted by a brunette (I believe the manager) who made check-in a breeze. Loved that. The location is really just incredible. Go over one bridge and past some shops and you are in St Marco square. A minute or less if you're walking with energy, I kid you not. Rialto in the other direction is less than 5 minutes. Superb. A few little things: there are lots of books downstairs about Venice that I found convenient. The elevator fits two people with luggage or five without. Once out of the elevator, you have to press a switch in the hallway to get light. As with other European hotels, the electricity only works in the rooms when your keycard is in the outlet near the door. Also, if there is no one at the front desk at night, they lock the door and you need your keycard to get inside. The room- Very spacious and for the price, quite a bargain if you like some extra breathing room. Apparently, there were cookies on the table when we entered, but my sister inhaled them, so I couldn't tell you if they were tasty or not. There was also water in the fridge, which was a god send. The prices for water, etc. provided by the hotel were really decent, too. I must note that our apartment (on the second floor, without view) is dark. It brings to mind the scene in Sex and the City : The Movie where Carrie goes up to the gorgeous penthouse while apartment searching and exclaims, "So this is where all the light is!" There really is no light here but if you pay extra and get a room with a view or one on the top floor, it will be different. I wasn't disappointed with this quite as much as my aunt was. It also somehow zaps your energy and you end up wanting to sleep. It took a lot of gusto to get out of the room once we settled in. The furnishings are nice and functional, the sofa bed was comfortable and didn't sink in the middle. The main bedroom was spacious with lots of closet room and the mucho important safe. It smelled delicious in there. My sister complained that every morning, it sounded like people were bowling upstairs. She also said that if she opened the windows at night, she woke up with mosquito bites. These are things I can not attest to, since I was in the living room, but they should be noted. I myself heard the cleaning service early in the morning, but I am a heavy sleeper and it didn't bother me or my aunt. The shower is AMAZING. The bathroom is very nice. The room came with slippers, which I still love to wear. Also came with a vanity kits and some great soaps. It's really convenient to have a tea kettle as sometimes you just don't want to pay for a coffee. The only thing I can really complain about was an incident involving payment. There was a very nice gentleman who was helpful, but when I brought up getting a discount if I paid in cash, which I had previously emailed the hotel about and they had confirmed, he said that my room rate did not include this discount. I really did not understand why, but what he said was that since I had booked with the hotel directly, there was nothing that could be done. Working in the service industry, I can somehow understand where is he is coming from. There are cases of miscommunication or misinformation. He wasn't at all rude or gruff about it, which I appreciated. Well anyway, I had all my emails printed out in case of this very situation and showed him how no one had mentioned that only certain rooms or bookings get certain rates, and he happily obliged to give us the discount. I thank him for that but I wonder what would have happened if I had no proof. Probably would have left a slightly sour taste in my mouth. Anyway, if in cash, the discount was 5% (40 euros for us) and that's significant enough to be worth the trouble. A tank of gas as far as I'm concerned. Food- We had dinner one night at Ristorante Malibran near Teatro Fenice (not the main teatro). It was delicious and a great place to people watch all those attending the theatre. The waiter was also excellent, servicing ALL the tables by himself. He was like a whirling dervish. I had quadro formaggi pasta yet again and it was rich and decadent, but not overpriced. We never found the restaurant again, by the way. The magic of Venice, for ya. There is also a great sandwich-type place on a street parallel to the St. Marco square. I forget what it's called, but the sandwiches were grilled to perfection and so tasty. Surprisingly, the gelato at Cafe Americano in the same square was also delicious. I suggest the hazelnut gelato ten times over. The bar scene is pretty dead in Venice, but my sister and I ventured out to the bar in the Campo St. Luca, going toward the Rialto bridge. It is a trip to see owners drinking with their dogs at foot. Must be a great conversation starter if you speak Italian. The scene was really not us, though. Very hipster. But amusing and worth the trip if you're bored. If you go over the Rialto during market owners, you must get a pear of any kind. They are SO delicious. A little less than a dollar. Entertainment- We didn't do the Secret Itinerary Tour (but I would definitely do it next time) but you do have to prepay for this tour online, and I really didn't feel like doing that. Oh well, next time. My aunt and I attended a wonderful one hour Vivaldi: Four Seasons concert at the Scuola Grande De San Teodoro. The performers dressed up in typical Venetian garb and the music was wonderful. I wish it lasted longer and was a little cheaper but again, you only live once. I wanted to make one more note. If you are heading back to Marco Polo Airport by Alillaguna waterbus line, the ride is pretty rocky and not for the weak of stomach! You kind of collide with the docks at every stop so don't try to sleep if you have the window seat. The ride is 12 euro and don't bother taking the gold line. It's only ten minutes faster than the red or blue lines back to the airport. Also, you have to go down a few steps to get to the seating (with your luggage) so those who are handicapped might have a hard time. You can stow your luggage before you sit, but again, you have to lift it when you're leaving. The stop is slightly further away from the actual airport than I expected and there is no shuttle. It's doable but not fun after a tiring trip, I can say that much. Everywhere you turn, Venice is like a work of art. A new and heart capturing scene everywhere you turn. It really is a magical place and I would return a million times. If I were with my family, I would definitely return to Corte Grimani. If you are looking for other rooms in Florence or Rome for families of four or more, I suggest checking out my reviews on Hotel II Perseo in Florence and Hotel Madrid in Rome. Hope this helped and email me with any questions! :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MuffinDordogne
Reviews.Content: Superb appartments in a city where bedrooms are normally tiny. Beds very good (and large) and plenty of room everywhere. Excellent location, about 10 minutes to either St Marks or Rialto, and generally very quiet. The Staff were without fail welcoming, polite, helpful, and responsive - would recommend this hotel to anyone without the slightest fear they would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia79
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviews. This place is hidden and very hard to find. Follow their directions carefully. Once we got there, it was amazing. I never expected a room like this in Venice for the rate given. Great views, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The gentleman at the front desk is very kind and helpful. Staying anywhere else would be foolish! The place is centrally located. Having such a wonderful place to stay added special ambiance to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “great but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: StPatrick17
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights as part of our honeymoon Europe tour, very hard to find as nobody knows where it is, but worth it when we found it. room over the canal was nice, singing gondoliers were nice in the evening but garbage collectors use the same canals in the morning as do suppliers and everybody else., so noisy in the morning, we will go back in December and take a room off the canal

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: trish z
Reviews.Content: We walked into our apartment at Corte Grimani and our first reaction was "This is the cleanest place we have ever stayed at in Italy." And we have stayed in small pensiones as well as 5 star hotels over the years. The hotel was an apartment building which was completely renovated in 2005 into 3 apartments per floor and is wonderful for families as there is so much room. It is about a 3 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. We had apartments #501 and #503, both on the top floor with delightful views over the rooftops. #501, which easily sleeps 6 (i king bed, 2 pull out queen size couches, 2 bathrooms as well as a living room/kitchen) also looked out over the canals - at a confluence of two so we could see bridges, activity, etc. Yet with the windows closed we heard just about nothing. There is a separate charge of 10 Euro/day for the use of the full kitchen as well as a 50 Euro kitchen cleaning charge. You can have breakfast brought to you for 15 Euro each (cereal, bread, croissants, yogurt, slice of ham and of cheese plus coffee/tea or chocolate) if you don't want to do it yourself. (Do be aware that if you arrive late on a Saturday you will have to go quite a ways on Sunday to get groceries as the small local groceries are closed on Sunday.) Donatella, the manager, was a great help via email prior to our stay - from where do we want the crib to arranging a motoscafi (water taxi) to pick us up at the train station and deposit us 4 feet from the front door. About 80 Euro for that, but well worth it if you are with a family and tired - plu you get such a wonderful first moments in Venice, down the Grand canal and then through a bunch of small canals. The front desk staff was very helpful and exceedingly friendly throughout the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only place in Venice that we've stayed that we would come back to!”
Reviews.Author: jillybeans88
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 2 night stay at the Corte Grimani for my husband's 60th birthday. It was everything I'd hoped for and more. Donatella thoughtfully provided us with a bottle of Prosecco on our arrival for my husband's birthday. As stated this was our 4th (but NOT last visit to Venice) my favourite city and this was the first place we've stayed that we would definitely both revisit. The appartment was clean, spacious and extremely comfortable. I think being on the top floor was the best place to be. We certainly did not notice any noise from any other rooms as I noticed another reviewer mentioned. Also as I do not usually cook when on city breaks not being able to use the kitchen caused us no problems at all! The access to the Internet was very useful and being able to check in and print our boarding passes off for our flight home was much appreciated. Specially when we saw the huge queue the next morning at the airport check-in and we walked straight to on-line bag drop. Just wanted to say thank you to Donatella (and the rest of the staff) for a terrific stay and for all your assistance and information. We will be back, though not in September it was too crowded for us!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay but...”
Reviews.Author: tracydish
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 3 days at the Corte Grimani...I would have scored this excellent, but there is a 'but'. The apartment itself lived up to or exceeded our expectations - location was fantastic and the rooms very spacious, clean and comfortable. We would recommend booking a room with a view on the canal as this includes singing gondaleers for free! BUT there was a down side - we were surprised to find out on arrival that the price quoted to us as a 'special rate' was only applicable if we paid in cash - any payment by debit or credit card incurring an extra 300 euros (or as they exaplained the full price). This was not clear on the booking terms and caused us no end of hassle withdrawing Â£250 cash each day to cover the bill, leaving us unable to use our cards for other purchases (some may say this is a good thing while in Venice?!) Worth watching for if you book direct with the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm!”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterwomanUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at the Corte Grimani. What a find! This is a fabulous place to stay. 2 minutes from St Marks Square but a calm oasis amidst the hustle and bustle. The room was fabulous, plenty of room for us and our 2 children aged 14 and 11. The staff were very helpful. I could not fault our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: caroleleeds
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the other reviews and were not disappointed. Fantastic location, only 5 mins walk from St Marks but in a very quiet cul de sac so no noise at night which was ideal. We had one of the smaller apartments which was just perfect - did not need the kitchen facilities but having a fridge and kettle was ideal for my early morning cup of tea. Lovely huge bed and tons of wardrobe space, far more than we needed. Great bathroom (with shower caps!) and I can see how this would be great for families as the facilities with dishwasher, clothers dryer etc are fantastic. We asked for recommendations for restaurants and both were excellent. We only did the breakfast on our last morning and it was pretty good value for the money. We should probably have done it more often as we found it surprisingly hard to get breakfast at a reasonable price locally (unlike France where every single cafe will do one). However a minor issue. We got the water taxi there and back and although expensive would definitely recommend this to guests as it is so much more convenient than waiting for the vaporetto and dragging your luggage across St Marks. We were on a very late evening flight and the hotel staff were more than happy for us to make full use of the lounge, watch TV etc after a long days shopping. Would defininitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alexburn
Reviews.Content: Well words escape as to how great this hotel was! I chose the hotel based on the reviews I read on this site, expecting a good value hotel with some positive points! But I really didnt expect to be blown away with such a great find! I had the most fantastic time in Venice and the whole experience was complimented by a good nights sleep in a clean and modern apartment, with great views over Venice and a location to match! The hotel is located just 2 minutes from St Marks Square in 1 direction and 2 minutes from Rialto Bridge in the other. Also, even though you are close to shops and restaurants in all directions, it isn't in a bustling area so you wont be disturbed by noisey neighbours or rowdy tourists! The staff were unbelievably friendly and very helpful... willing to do anything for you and didnt mind if you booked in or out later than the specified times! The maid even came back an hour later when we fancied a lie in one morning! If you're stuck for ideas on what to do or where to go, just ask the staff! The view from our 5th floor apartment (classic with view) was breathtaking, with St Marks Tower in the distance and a view over a canal where you'll often hear a singing gondaleer! Its a great thing to wake up to! Air conditioning worked a treat and was seperately controllable in both the living room and the bedroom. The bathroom had a good power shower, a heated towel rail and a hairdryer. The kitchen was adequate although we never opted for the 50 Euro use of it... perhaps more useful for longer term residents. There were even free cookies and a 2L bottle of water waiting for us for free! I cant possibly think of a bad word to say about the place. We booked a last minute deal direct on their website... best room for just 200 Euros a night... well worth it considering the standard price is 250 a night! Sounds expensive, but cheaper than some other places in Venice and at least you know what you're getting for your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Another 5”
Reviews.Author: SingleDad08
Reviews.Content: Not much else to add here - stayed on a weekend late July with my teenagers. Location is perfect - Piazza San Marco was our beacon when we got lost. The rooms are even brighter and airier than their website suggests. Was a little expensive, but so was everything in Venice with the weak dollar. Excellent service, very clean, very friendly. They're doing everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Enjoyed the Residence Corte Grimani”
Reviews.Author: Lucygirl2
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this gem of a hotel after reading the wonderful reveiws on Trip Advisor, and it did not disappoint. Donatella, Guido, and the entire staff helped us with everything from restaurant reservations to tracking down lost luggage. We took a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotels doorstep. It was expensive, but well worth it, especially with luggage. Venice is not the easiest place to get around with luggage. The hotel is located right around the corner from St. Marks Square, away from all of the crowds and noise. It is tucked away on a charming little street that's easy to find once you have been there. We stayed in 2 apartments on the 4th floor that were both spacious and clean. We looked forward to returning to them each evening after a long day of sightseeing. We did not use the kitchen, but did order breakfast from the hotel on the last morning of our stay. It was both plentiful and well worth the cost of 12 euros per person. We will always remember our trip to Venice and the wonderful hospitality we received at the Residence Corte Grimani.

Reviews.Title: “Made the holiday”
Reviews.Author: foxski
Reviews.Content: It was a real pleasure staying at this hotel for a number of reasons. 1) Comfort and decor were very good. 2) Location: very close to San Marco but relatively quiet / exclusive area - nice shops etc. 3) The suite was perfect for sharing with our two 8 year olds. 4) The staff were very helpful at all times. 5) Room service was reasonably priced. We opted for the breakfast (served in the room) on one day of our stay - it was excellent and more than ample (too much) - @12 euro a head we found it expensive ( because our children just wanted juice and bread) and we could find a good breakfast for at least half this price in local bars. It was our first trip to Venice and the experience was greater than our expectations, in part this was because we enjoyed this hotel as a family. We will certainly be recommending this accommodation to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Choice”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSurrey
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate to stay here - it's a lovely hotel, well deserving of its Trip Advisor awards. We stayed in 501 - 2 huge rooms, (I massive double bed, 2 double sofa beds) 2 bathrooms, kitchen and dining area. Beautifully decorated and quiet location; pretty views of canal. Very helpful front desk staff, helped with great restaurant recommendations and airport travel logistics. Ample breakfasts, plenty of variety, served in room (no restaurant in the hotel). Central - short walk from St Marks. Free 15 mins internet use via lobby pc - useful for flight check-in etc. Our teenager complained that the sofa bed matress was a bit hard! Great shopping nearby (above Armani) and numerous reastaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous with a baby”
Reviews.Author: Brusselsprout
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights with my one year old and my mother. It was absolutely fantastic - central but quiet and you could watch the gondolas right outside the window floating down the canal. The hotel supplied a high chair and cot and it was very easy to cater due to the excellent kitchen facilities within the apartment. I slept in the lounge diner, my baby slept in a walk in wardrobe area and I let grandma have the main bedroom. There were two bathrooms. It was all spotless, loads of space and very tasteful with lovely wooden beamed ceilings. It is certainly a bargain considering the standard and location. You felt totally part of the action even whilst eating your breakfast, as you watched the gondolas float by. St Marks Square is less than five mins walk and the rialto about 7 mins. One recommendation if you are travelling with a baby - take a backpack type thing as carrying prams over all the bridges which have stairs cut into them and which are everywhere is not great for the back! The water taxi took us too and from the airport and went right to the front door - don't let them tell you the water is too high - they said that to us but then when they realised we had a baby they magically managed to get us right to the hotel by canal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: gardener080
Reviews.Content: We followed the other rave reviews and booked 4 nights at Corte Grimani. Yes, it is absolutely wonderful. Huge spacious rooms and immaculately presented. Not glitzy. Very central location. Discretely positioned, we found it without difficulty by following their map. Adequate English spoken by reception staff. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Refined and comfortable with great location”
Reviews.Author: rwaites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Corte Grimani for 4 nights at the end of a 17 day trip to Northern Italy. The stay there was just perfect in every way. It is a small and refined hotel with a private water taxi stop at the front door and 1 block from St. Mark's Square. The front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. We booked a corner suite with two bathrooms and a small kitchen/dining area overlooking the canal. We were really happy with it. The rooms were large and well appointed with classic contemporary furniture. I agree completely with all the other reviewers who liked this hotel. Most amazing was the room rate which we found to be very reasonable in Venice. Because the hotel is so close to St. Mark's Square, you can buy a day pass on the vaporetto (city public water taxi) and be anywhere in the Venice area for sightseeing locations in minutes. In addition, we felt like we had our own apartment in Venice and it felt great to come home to it every night we were in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rkgl
Reviews.Content: We found the site through Fodors and/or Trip Advisor. Great Location. Quiet. Clean. Very good staff. The beds were firm (hip, hip, hooray). The a/c worked. We rented a place with a kitchen. Under 5 minute walk to San Marco Square. The staff was always great about making resturant recommendations. We really have nothing bad to say. Venice can be tough to navigate when you are trying to find your hotel vs. the train station or however. We took a private water taxi to the hotel. More expensive, but it worked well for us. I would glady return and gladly stay at the same hotel. Oh, I found a negative - the lift was small. We took the stairs. It seems that all lifts (elevators) in Italy are small, not just here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamahena
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Corte Grimani and very impressed by the location, friendly service and excellent set-up. The room was like a mini apartment with two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a small kitchenette. Definitely worth splashing out for rooms with a view over the canal. The space is large, very stylishly furnished, spotless and air conditioned. Don't forget to close the shutters at night - keeps out the early morning sunshine. Exactly what we wanted - no over-priced restaurant or gift shop, just a small and comfortable place with very friendly and helpful staff. Cannot recommend this more highly - and the location is fabulous. Literally 5 mins walk to St Mark's and very close to the Rialto. Take the map to find the exact location - or if you forget, as we did, just ask for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved loved loved this place! It is a GEM of a find!”
Reviews.Author: Princesse30
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (my parents, 2 brothers and I) just returned from our Europe vacation where we spent 5days in Venice and our stay at the Residence Corte Grimani definitely contributed to making our stay in Venice a very memorable one. We're so glad we found this gem of a hotel thanks to tripadvisor!!! PROS: Location. Location. Location. Its very near Piazza San Marco but just around a small street corner so you're still away from the noise and the hustle and bustle. {TIP If you have a lot of luggage its easier to have a water taxi bring you directly here from the airport, its very convenient since they have a water dock right at their doorstep.} The room's lovely picturesque window with beautiful flowers on the ledge is overlooking the canal where you can watch the gondolas pass by and also has a great view of the Goldina Bridge that leads to the Piazza. They serve a generous and hearty breakfast right in the room which is very very convenient. Friendly, warm, helpful and welcoming staff especially Donatella. Travel and guide books on loan in the lobby. Free wired internet access in the room and internet station in the lobby. Well maintained/ Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Good water pressure. Bedroom slippers provided. Ample towels. Very comfortable bed in the master's suite Great airconditioning. Large rooms - comfortably spacious for 5 adults and 10 pieces of luggage. Sufficient closet & drawer space. Made use of the kitchen since there are delis and bakeries nearby so this was a nice addition. CONS: (a very minor one) but the sofa bed in the second room and sofa bed in the master's suite was not that comfortable and could be improved although it was not that bad

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: LC_DC_Aus
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from an overseas trip that included 3 days in Venice at the Corte Grimani. We had an apartment which had loads of space.... comfortable bed.....super clean.....large telly & fantastic views overlooking a canal with Gondolas passing by , it was heaven. We had breakfast there the first morning which was basic but nice. We caught a waterbus from the main station to the hotel & got off at the Rialto stop. We did get a little lost walking to the hotel the 1st time but after that no problems, it's really easy to get around Venice. Make sure you do the walking / canal boat tour it's a great way to see the city if you only have a few days. The hotel staff all spoke excellent english & were very friendly & helpful. We chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor & were certainly glad we did this place is just beautiful. We can't wait to come back to Venice & will definately stay at Corte Grimani again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grandmahazel
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel was nice. It was difficult to find, but I did recognize the spot from a picture on the hotel website. The hotel staff was helpful and the room was large. There were four of us and we had a living room-kitchen with a fold out bed and a Bedroom. We decided not to pay the 50eu. to use the kitchen because we did not need to cook. We were able to use the refrigerator and the cups and spoons and made hot water in the electric pot. The canal was close by, you could see it out the window and we could hear the gondolars singing. There is a computer in the lobby that worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment!”
Reviews.Author: cgpit
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Corte Grimani. What a fantastic and awesome apartment. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Our apartment had a great view of one of the small canals in Venice. It was located off a side street but was right in San Marco, in the midst of everything. The apartment itself was very new and modern and a housekeeper came daily to keep it in great shape. The lobby had internet access and someone on staff at all times. I would definitely stay here again when i come of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Residence Corte Grimani is Wonderful”
