Reviews.Author: TirolTosca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful, several-day stay at the Residence Corte Grimani at the end of May into the beginning of June 2008. We have been to Venice several times before, staying at top hotels and without doubt the Corte Grimani is the best place to stay. Corte Grimani is in a wonderful, central location, and very conveniently can be reached by water taxi when you have heavy luggage (aboout â‚¬70). It provides apartments, rather than hotel rooms. We rented an apartment with a bedroom, living room, kitchen and two bathrooms, and our apartment was large, spacious and scrupulously clean. We had charming views of canals from both rooms. The value in comparison to a hotel room, particularly a top hotel room, is extraordinary. Corte Grimani is reasonably priced and you get fabulous space, daily maid service and superb service from the staff. They also provide, if you want, a very good breakfast for a small additional price that is well worth it. Every single person of the staff--from front desk reception to maids--is extraordinarily friendly and helpful. They all provide top notch service, including concierge service with wonderful restaurant recommendations. We were very impressed. They made sure that our celebration of 22 years of marriage was a lovely, romantic time. Corte Grimani is a true gem of a place to stay. Mille Grazie to them from us!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: KiminDen
Reviews.Content: This is a great property for families. Lots of space. It is a little tricky to find, but is in a brilliant location very close to the Rialto bridge and St. Mark's Square. Get a good map (you will need it anyway!), follow the hotel directions, and you should be fine. We were a bit disappointed that the water taxi could not (or would not) get us directly to the hotel, but we understood once we saw the queue of gondolas in the canal! Our only complaints were with the additional charges for the kitchen use (50 euros if you want it opened at all) and for the breakfast. Also, there was air-conditioning, but it seemed pretty ineffective! The provided toiletries (shampoo, etc.) were barely sufficient and were supplemented by our own travel supplies. The "down-sides" are easily out-weighed by the positives of this property. Internet access was free in the room (not wireless - and you have to get the code every 24 hours). It was great to have the refrigerator in the room to store cold drinks, etc. Prices for water, soda, beer, wine, etc. were VERY reasonable (as cheap as we found in the shops). The guidebooks on "loan" in the lobby area were appreciated. The staff at reception were helpful, but did not go out of their way to be friendly. Overall, it was a great experience, and was much more cost effective than booking 2 separate rooms for 2 adults and 2 teens.

Reviews.Title: “Donatello is fabulouso! We recommend this absolutely!”
Reviews.Author: NZHolly
Reviews.Content: We booked here having read the reviews on Tripadvisor, My husband, 2 daughters and I originally booked for 4 nights, but due to a train issue had to change to 3 nights. Franco and Donatella could not have been more helpful. I emailed them a couple of times about various things, they provided links to other websites to help with bookings, asked customers what they thought of a local show, organised a water taxi to meet us at the train station and were absolutely lovely in every way possible. We booked an apartment with a bedroom and living room, and the living room contained a comfortable fold out sofa bed. The bedroom was enormous - and very lovely with antique looking furniture throughout. The rooms were very clean, and manuals for the washer / dryer & dishwasher were on hand. Our apartment had 2 bathrooms, so there was plenty of room for us! We had a view over the canal and it was lovely watching the boats carrying mail, fruit & vegetables in the morning! In the afternoons the gondoliers went past singing, which was also very special! We were very close to Capo San Luca (5 mins) where we could pick up all kinds of groceries. We were also only 5 mins from St Marks Square. It was lovely to walk around Venice early in the morning, or in the evenings when the bus groups had gone. A great time of year to visit, and we will definitely return to these apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Our Own Apartment in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: GirlieGirlTravel
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Residence Corte Grimani on the last few nights of our trip to Italy. We had previously been in Rome and then Florence. This hotel is more of an apartment building with actual apartments inside! We were shocked when we opened the door. The price at the time (November 2007) ran us about $300 USD per night and it was worth every penny. The large entrance then revealed a full-size kitchen. There was a small hallway with a large bathroom. The bedroom was also large with two full-size beds. The staff was attentive and available at all times. The breakfast was an additional $10 USD, per person, but worth the money. It consisted of fresh meats and breads and, of course, Nutella which my friend can't get enough of :) Here's a heads-up if you happen to be a beer drinker like we are. The hotel had Heineken bottles for only $1.50 USD. That was the cheapest beer on our entire trip. We were routinely paying over $5 a beer through Italy. It was nice to sit in our Venice apartment having cheaper beer! I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Venice, especially families if you are needing the room. You could easily accomodate teenagers and adults in one of these spacious apartments. The living room consisted of a pull-out sofa in addition to the large bedroom. I cannot think of one negative thing to say about the Residence Corte Grimani and I think of myself as pretty picky.

Reviews.Title: “Fanstastic for families”
Reviews.Author: speedyseven
Reviews.Content: This residence is in a perfect position in the heart of Venice. Our party of five included two teenagers and grandma. The superior appartment was perfect, two bathrooms, two separate rooms, a kitchen and lots of space! The view of the canal from the window was lovely. Very quiet, very clean, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mindwanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed for 3 nights in early April 2008. We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and on value - we stayed in a Superior Suite with two corner rooms and a view over a canal through multiple lovely windows. The decor is not fancy but it is exceptionally clean, quite comfortable, and very functional. Everything in the apartment worked (we didn't use the kitchen or washer/dryer) and our apartment smelled clean and was immaculately sparkling on arrival. Don't be turned off by reviews stating something smells bad in Venice - when the tide is low, the lower levels of all the buildings in the whole city can sometimes smell bad - its not a reason to fault a place, but it is a reason to never book a room on the ground floor. The staff at the front desk had not one ounce of attitude and were always very pleasant and very helpful. The owner/manager Donatella was refreshingly open and helpful and more than willing to accomodate a later check-out given no-one had reserved our room for the coming night. We took their advice for dinner one night and had a lovely meal. The internet was indeed free, fast, and easily available in the room (we brought a laptop). The location was superb - 3 minutes walk to St. Mark's square, easy 15 min stroll to Academia or Rialto bridges, and really no problem to find from St. Mark's if you print out their web site's location map. The value is fantastic for Venice - especially if you are someone that values space, or if you are travelling with a family and need space. Don't hesitate to book this hotel if it is available for your trip - you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: TxBeech
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel added to our enjoyment of this beautiful city. Donatella and her brother Guido are charming and helpful, we felt very well cared for over our 3 night stay. The apartment was modern and yet the decor carried the character of the city. We could see a small canal out the windows, which had wooden shutters. We had a breakfast brought up to our room one morning and I regret not snapping a photo of the presentation before we dove into the variety of breads, yogurts, cheeses, fresh fruit, jams,etc., it was lovely. The bathroom was very large and well appointed, and we enjoyed the nice touch of complimentary slippers. I do not have one negative comment. Excellent on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: glitterjunkie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel back in December for a romantic weekend, actually he surprised me with the trip and booked this hotel because it was number one on Trip Advisor! It thoroughly desrves it's number one ranking (how can this be rated as a two star?? It should be four stars!), superb value for money, the location is second to none, right in the centre of Venice but hidden away in a quiet corner which admittedly was a bit too hidden away when we were trying to find it, even a local Venetian who took it upon himself to help us find it didn't know of it's existence!! Very close to St. Mark's square and not far from the Rialto bridge. The staff checked us in and showed us to our apartment very quickly. Throughout our stay they were all friendly and willing to help in any way in which they could. We were stuck for somewhere to have dinner on our last night and they recommended the excellent Bar Centrale which was very swish and sophisticated, sumptuous food, a low-key relaxed atmosphere and somewhere the well heeled in Venice frequent! The apartment itself was massive! The open plan kitchen living area felt spacious and had enough room for a large sofa and table and chairs without feeling crammed in. The entire apartment was spotlessly clean and neutrally decorated. The bathroom was huge with plenty of toiletries supplied, slippers and even a washing machine! Again the bedroom was large on scale with a king sized bed and plenty of wardrobe and drawer space with a view out onto the canal. We never got up in time for breakfast but I'm sure it was delicious, instead we went to one of the cafe's nearby and had hot chocolate and croissants! Just one thing to note, there is a particularly putrid smell at all time in reception from the nearby canals/ drains but once you get in the lift the air is somewhat sweeter smelling. I would definately go back so if you are thinking of booking, just do it!

Reviews.Title: “Almost five stars”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place to stay indeed. We had a two bedroom classic apartment on the second floor. It was absolutely spotless - and I mean spotless (not even a hint of mould, dust, stains or marks on anything) - it was in tip top condition and was very stylish - gold and cream everywhere. It felt like somewhere we should be paying twice the price to stay in. They provided lovely towels, bath gels, manicure sets and carpet slippers to pad about in. It cost us 140 euro per night as we had a cash deal. Our child stayed free. There are a few things that stop me giving this place five stars (and I'm probably being a bit picky here but I think it is useful for people to know these things): the smell of the canal wafting into the reception and also up the stairwells (that's probably why they had beautiful air fresheners in our room), the thinness of the walls (we could hear next door having a heated discussion and then the next night getting amorous at 1 am!) and the incidental things that they did/didn't do, like wanting to charge a supplement for setting the single bed up instead of the sofa bed that was set up for our son in the dining area, not having a tv in our bedroom despite the floor plan showing that we should have one and teatowels to dry the cups and saucers with (there was no charge to make hot drinks). I would suggest that if you have a child and want to watch tv in the evening ask if they can set the single bed up in the second bedroom before you arrive instead of the sofa bed at no extra cost. English speaking tv was limited to CNN - but they have so many nationalities to cater for I can't expect BBC everywhere I go! The staff were so friendly and helpful, the location was brilliant - we walked everywhere even with a 5 year old in tow. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel but if you are prepared to eat on the hoof at one of the many cafes or bars then you can breakfast much more cheaply. If you stand at the counter it's cheaper than sitting at a table. Try San Polo for eating and visiting - slightly cheaper than the central area, much less frenetic with less tourists and a more 'authentic' italian feel. You can walk it from the residence in about 20 mins via the Accademia bridge. Be careful of the trattoria Antica Capon in the Campo Sant Margarita! Very friendly front of house/head waiter and when we walked in they guided us to an outside table and then charged us 4.25 euros for a capuccino. We didn't get a receipt which you are supposed to get in Italy otherwise you/the owner can be fined. We'll know better next time. Nice little cafe opposite tho' on the bend in the same square who only charged us 1.60 euros for a cappuccino. We got the water bus from the airport to San Marco, cost 24 euro for both adults and it took over an hour. On the way back we walked from the hotel to Piazzale Roma and got the express bus to the airport. Took 30 mins to walk (really scenic too) and only 15 mins on the bus - cost us 6 euro in total. Despite the little niggles that stopped it being absolutely perfect, I would highly recommend the Corte Grimani as fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Truly memorable”
Reviews.Author: Naishcombe
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based on the previous Trip Advisor reports. It is hard to fault any aspect of our stay. We were 2 couples and had 2 of the larger apartments with views of the canal. Rooms were very spacious, exceptionally clean and the large beds very comfortable. Heating was responsive and toiletries of a good standard. We ate breakfast there on each of the 3 days - a good quality continental style buffet with good supply of fresh fruit. The reception staff were helpful. The hotel is very well located just a few minutes walk from St Mark's Square where you can board a waterbus to most areas. Barry Jones

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grimani last weekend for 3 nights on a short break to Venice. Like most reviewers here, I booked this particular hotel because of its rating on Trip Advisor. I had contacted the Grimani in advance and been told that a water taxi from the airport was 100 euro, whilst the water bus was 12 euros each. I thought the water taxi was a bit pricey, so did not prebook. However, when we arrived in Venice on Thursday evening, we found that the water bus is hourly at that time of night, at ten past the hour. To avoid a 40 minute wait, we did take a water taxi from the airport at 90 euros. It was a lovely experience in itself, and much better than the bus. This dropped us at the Rialto Bridge, and we had a short walk to the hotel through the shopping area. The path to the hotel from the shops, almost looks like you are walking into the canal. If you are expecting that, its not difficult to find. Upon arrival at Grimani we were greeted by an Italian man who did not speak any English. Whilst I fully accept that I should be the one speaking Italian ! and can't, it was disorientating not to understand what he was saying. We had apartment 502 which has a brilliant view over the rooftops, to the tower in St Marks square. It was very quiet and peaceful, and spotlessly clean. There was no information regarding breakfast arrangements in the apartment, and as our host could not speak English, I am not certain whether this was available during our stay. We certainly didnt get up in time anyway ! As previous reviews have said, the apartment had all the facilities you would expect, and a couple of wine glasses would have been a nice extra. Unfortunately I personnally found the beds and pillows uncomfortable, and did not sleep particularly well during the stay. I think it is worth mentioing that the apartment is excellent value for the money you pay, and the location is perfect. It is a good 3 to 4 star experience, and much better value that the luxury hotels. On the first evening we ate out at a small restaurant in the shopping area - Antique Carbonara I think. It was excellent. A seafood restaurant with lovely fresh fish, excellent service, and wonderful desserts. The following lunchtime we ate at da Fiore in the St Paolo area, which is recommended in all the guides. It is a bit of a trek, and dont get it mixed up with the one in St Maros area. I had tried to book in advance, but they required credit card details. Luckily it was not full on this Friday lunchtime. This was a great restaurant as well. There are 2 two seater tables beside the canal, and its worth asking for one of these if you're feeling particularly romantic. Over the next two days we ate at the Grand Canal restaurant in the Monaco hotel, and Canova in another 5 star hotel. It was pleasant enough, but I wouldnt necessarily return. Monaco was very touristy, and Canova was stuffy (in my view), although the service was very good. Our lunch at Canova was more expensive than we paid in the 7 star hotel in Dubai ! Grimani were very helpful in making bookings for us. We saw Vivaldi played in period costume at Scuola Grande di San Teodoro, which is 5 minutes from the hotel, and worth the cultural experience. That can be booked on line with Classictic before you go, and they email you the tickets. We also visited a Jazz Bar close to the Rialto Bridge. We were very surprised to find the Jazz consisted of a DVD being played on a screen in the bar. When it finished, they played the same DVD again ! It was a pleasant enough evening, but was full of tourists. There seemed to be little choice if you were seeking evening entertainment in Venice. Overall a great weekend break in Venice, and a good experience at Grimani. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Everything they say!”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Like all the other reviewers, we thought this was an excellent choice for Venice. Location is very convenient, and yet it is quiet. Except for the singing gondoliers if you open your windows - but who could object to that! We used a vaporetto to get there from Piazzale Roma, where we dropped off our hire car - and that was quite an experience. Incidentally, watch your change when you buy your vaporetto tickets as we were short-changed (but challenged it and got a refund.) We used the directions given by other reviewers in Trip Advisor and found the hotel without too much difficulty. It's easy walking on to the vaporettos with suitcases, but be aware you will have to carry cases over bridges to get to the hotel. Used the vaporetto service to the airport when we left and this worked fine. The owners of Corte Grimani are very pleasant, and concerned with detail, and this is no doubt why it is so well-liked. They gave us some good restaurant recommendations too. We had a generously-sized two bed, two bath apartment (401) with canal view. Everything was spotlessly clean, and there were nice touches like disposable slippers. Also was one of the few places on this trip to Italy where there was a powerful hairdryer. To use the washer/dryer combination in the apartment there is a five euro charge. It was very, very slow. Ironing board and iron are free on request. Kitchen use is 50 euros but we didn't bother, instead we had the 10 euro breakfast which was very nice, with a reasonable selection. Free internet access in the lobby. All in all, would recommend a stay here if you want a central location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: magicbassetlab
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 daughters and mother in law stayed at Corte Grimani for two nights in Jan 08. We stayed at a wonderful, cozy apartment composed of a very large bedroom with a queen/king bed, and a pullout queen bed. The master bedroom was luxurious. The other room had another pullout queen bed and it's own bathroom, as well as a small kitchen with all amenities, a plasma TV and a dining area. We had quaint views of the canal. The room was sparkling clean and perfect for our group...lots of space. The customer service was A+. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel, and the buffet was very complete. There is also complimentary internet in the room (but not wireless). Besides its comfort, the best asset of this apt. hotel is is location. It is in a quiet corner, only 2-3 blocks from Piazza San Marco, close to all major attractions, restaurants and shops. We recommend taking a water taxi directly to the hotel entrance and also back to the airport if you're flying out of Marco Polo airport. Overall, it was a perfect experience....we would definitely stay there again when visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: VivienneM64
Reviews.Content: I only heard about the Corte Grimani from Trip Advisor and read all the good reviews. I was not disappointed. The hotel was located perfectly in between San Marco (5 minutes walk) and the Rialto Bridge (10 mins walk). We arrived by water taxi from the airport which took us right to the door and were welcomed by friendly helpful staff. The room was large, clean and comfortable, with excellent facilities. There was a full kitchen (although the use of this was not included in the room rate) and a washing machine and dryer (for a small additional cost). There was also free internet access in the room. The only criticism we had was that the sofa bed in the living room had a fairly uncomfortable mattress and the breakfast and kitchen use were expensive. Otherwise a wonderful stay and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanragazza
Reviews.Content: I only heard about this hotel because this site. I wasn't sure if it would live up to the hype and it did (for me at least.). If you are looking for a full service place with lots of amenities this is not the right hotel for you. The rooms are more like apartments. My room was huge and on the 5th floor with incredible views. My room was very affordable for a very expensive city. Going "off season" had it's advantages. The location is perfect. Close to San Marco and the Rialto but in a quiet pocket of the city. Donatella and Maurizio were the nicest people. I had long conversations with both of them. They made me feel right at home. I went by myself but this would be a great option for a family. There is a living room/kitchen area separate from the bedroom. The decor is spare but warm (which I like) and the room was spotless. I also liked the free internet access. Very nice touch. When I go back to Venice I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissima View! Fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: hkleinberg
Reviews.Content: We found the Corte Grimani orginally on Trip Advisor and it was rated very highly. We found that it was better to book directly through the hotel site. We agreed to pay in cash to save a little extra as well. There were 5 of us that stayed in the suite which had one double bed (well, two twins pushed together as is common is Europe, Mind the Gap!) and two sofa beds (that were actually more comfortable.) We paid 300 euros per night which was a little more expensive because we asked for a view of the canal, and I must say, it was totally worth it! I think some of the morning staff were looking for a more fashionable clientel as my friend was treated a bit rudely, but the night crew was perfectly welcoming. All in all, very satisfied with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: SWNH
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location in Venice. A quiet location just 5 minute walk to the madness of San Marco and 10 minute walk to Rialto Bridge. We had a one bedroom suite with full kitchen (which we never used) and free internet. The suite was exceedingly clean and comfortable. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful and gave us great recommendations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Benalmadena01
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor.com We stayed for three nights at a price of 180 euros a night. It was 10 euros a night cheaper to book through their own internet site. I wrote in the booking notes that I had used tripadvisor.com and also e-mailed them a week before my stay to advise them of my arrival time. On arrival I was very pleased to learn that we had been upgraded to a superior room on the third floor. One late afternoon we returned to the room just to relax and warm up for a little while. Franca rang from the reception, offered us two glasses of sparkling white wine and brought them up for us. Very nice. Beautiful hotel, beautiful people.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Through our Whole Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: adonny24
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for our last days in Italy for our honeymoon based on the tripadvisor comments. We were so happy we did. The residence was great - our apartment was such a nice break from the tight hotel rooms we'd been in the whole trip. For less then we spent at luxury boutique hotels we had a place to stay that was AT LEAST 3 times larger. We stayed in the deluxe with canal view on the top floor. Exposed beams and views of a quiet canal AND the top of St. Mark's Square. It was breathtaking. The location was quiet but in a safe area just a 2 minute walk from St. Marks. It was impeccably clean, the owners very nice, and I can not recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: juno100
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Venice. We ended a cruise there and decided to extend our stay four nights. We based our reservation at Residence Corte Grimani on tripadvisor reviews. The value for the price of Euro 280 in the heart of San Marco sestiere is incredible. The room was so spacious and clean that we couldn't have asked for more. We rented a superior room, more space than two people would ever need, but felt that after two weeks of traveling (business and personal) that we could use some extra space. The staff, to a person, are friendly and seem to know everything. Their recomendation of the water taxi service saved us quite a bit of money, and when the taxi company didn't want to pick us up the day we were leaving because of the high tides, they observed that other taxis were getting by (the potential problem is that the high water makes it difficult to get under the bridges in the smaller canals) and called the service to insist that we would be picked up at the hotel. Indeed we were, and exactly on time. We didn't end up using the kitchen. Although Venice is extremely expensive, there are ways to eat out. Split a pizza and have a half bottle of wine for lunch at a cafe (for a couple), or pick up panini at a local tratoria. The hotel sells Coke for a mere E 1.50; it can run you E 4-8 in a restaurant! Dinner is another matter. It is hard for a couple to get away less than E 60 - 70 even if you have a 1/2 bottle of wine. Between the coperto (cover charge), the servicia (included 12% service), a salad, entree, and a cappucino it adds up quick. I can see where a family would definately need the kitchen. We were baffled by the washer/dryer combo. We finally did get one load complete, and that really saved us. We are not usually confused by small appliances at home; even with several degrees between us it seems we still lack the necessary skills to operate Italian appliances. The rooms themselves are sparely, but beautifully decorated. The location is perfection itself. We know friends who have spent much more for much less in Venice. Residence Corte Grimani deserves it's stellar reputation. We did have a view in room 201 and loved listening to the gondoliers in the afternnoon if we were taking a break from sight seeing. Venizia e bella!

Reviews.Title: “In agreement with the other reviewers: an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: syncopation1234
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on the reviews on this website and on the whole we were not disappointed. We stayed for three nights at 270 Euros a night for a mini-apartment (for a family with teenage daughters). Some of the rooms had views overlooking the front of the hotel or the canal that runs alongside it, but, alas, ours did not. Pluses: (1) Very clean and welcoming, (2) very knowledgeable staff: Donatella , Franca and Guido were able to help us with finding grocery stores and restaurants. Franca was good enough to try and get us tickets to the â€œDogeâ€™s Palace Secrets Tourâ€� but they were fully booked. Consummate hospitality professionals, all three of them. (3) Located 2 minutes from St Markâ€™s Square, and right close by all the high end shops. (4) They allowed us to check in at 12 noon, but we called them the night before telling them when we would be arriving and they said our room would be ready (what other hotel lets you check in so early?). (5) â€œhonour-systemâ€� library in the lobby, where they have several books about Venice that you can help yourself to, so long as you return it when youâ€™re done. Minuses: (1) our room had no view, I suppose this is luck of the draw depending on what room they give you and what kind of room you book. (2) They add a 50 Euro extra charge to â€œopen the kitchenâ€�, i.e. unlock the cupboard where all the pots, pans, cutlery, etc. The charge, they say, is for the clean up of the kitchen after you leave. At this rate, you would think they could provide a little washing up soap, dishwasher soap, and maybe a little salt/pepper shaker. But all in all, if you are staying two or more days, having a kitchen is handy for a few meals, and the 50 euros pays for itself on the VERY HIGH cost of meals in Venice (1 lunch for family of 4). (On subject of food preparation, check out the Rialto market (walk back to Rialto bridge, cross over, and itâ€™s off to the right, dozens of stalls selling fresh fish every morning, + great fruit and veg, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: gutguido
Reviews.Content: Add me as another very satisfied customer. We stayed in an "Apartment Classic" on the 2nd floor, with no view. Room was spacious, clean, and exactly as advertised on the web site. Our hostesses Donatella and Franca were so friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Donatella in particularly seems like a walking encyclopedia of knowledge about Venice. If there is anything you need, leave your request with the two of them, and you can definitely rest assured that everything will be taken care of promptly and well. The location is great - literally steps away from San Marco's. Ferries are within a two to three minute walk. All this for the price of 200 Euros per night, which for Venice surely must represent fantastic value. Heartily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit to Corte Grimani but I hope not our last”
Reviews.Author: David505
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Residence Corte Grimani, the welcome we received could not have been warmer and it felt as though we were returning to our Venetian home. This time we took a friend with us and he is convinced that there can be no better hotel in the whole of Venice. He says that he wants to visit Venice again soon and would not consider staying anywhere else. Donatella and Franca are always ready to offer help and advice and Guido's breakfasts are a satisfying start to a day's sightseeing. When one considers that the hotel is in the heart of Venice, a major tourist city, the value for money is tremendous, the accommodation in the smallest apartment is spacious, quiet and impeccably clean and, as I have said above, everyone is very pleasant and very helpful. Any visitor using British Airways flights (I cannot speak for any other carriers) can use the computer terminal in reception to Check In 24 hours before your flight which saves a lot of time when you get to the airport. I would by very happy to recommend Residence Corte Grimani to anyone thinking of visiting La Serenissima. David Holland, Bedford, UK

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLaJolla
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 perfect weeks at the Residence Corte Grimani in September. Our apartment was spacious, bright, and spotless, with wonderful views over the rooftops to the domes and the campanile of the Basilica San Marco. The neighborhood was convenient and pleasant, lively during the day, quiet at night. In all of Venice, there can be no better hosts than Donatella, Guido, and Franca, all of whom made us feel completely at home throughout our stay, as did Cristina in the breakfast room. Because it is usually best, as well as a courtesy, to reserve for dinner at Italian restaurants, the telephone with free local calls was helpful. Many reviews mention how great this hotel is for families, but we also recommend it to couples who would enjoy a quiet, comfortable, attractive home-away-from-home. We could live there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sarahbeingsarah
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in the most romantic spot right on the canal. Yes, difficult to find on first arriving, but that's the only thing I'd say to watch out for. The location was perfect, right in the centre of things but not so close that noise is a problem. The room was lovely and so were the staff. I think this is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, families or not”
Reviews.Author: SurfJogger
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest vacation hotels I have ever visited -- and I'm 62. What makes it so special is the attention of the staff. They will help you with any question. The rooms are good and, most important for those with families, large. As far as I could tell, all were two room suites. We were traveling with a small child, and the in-room washing machine turned out to be essential. Given what the hotel is providing, the location is really a plus, maybe 200 yards from St Mark's square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy88
Reviews.Content: The Corte Grimani Residence was perfect for us. We are a family of 4. Our children, both boys, were 16 and 18 (6ft, 190lbs each). I booked the regular sized room with a view to save money and was worried that perhaps I had made a mistake. No problem at the Corte Grimani. The boys both slept on the pull out couch, which we left out all of the time, and we still had enough space to play cards at the table in that room. Both rooms were very large as was the bathroom. We did not use the laundry or stove. The fridge came in handy for snacks and drinks. The hotel is newly remodeled, clean, cool and spacious. The owners could not be nicer and breakfast was worth every Euro. We would definately stay here again. Two things to note once again, as others have mentioned: Be very careful in following the map to this hotel when arriving in Venice. It is a little tricky in that the hotel is right on a canal and you turn right on a little sidewalk by a canal bridge. No problem after you have found it once. The second thing is remember to shut your rooms stutters at night or you will be up with the dawn. You need to open the windows and unlatch them from the side of the building. Enjoy Venice it was my favorite big city in Italy. There is nothing else like it in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay with family!”
Reviews.Author: jdbnyc
Reviews.Content: A perfectly planned holiday can be ruined if the hotel one stays at is not ideal. Don't worry about this at the Grimani. My three year old daughter, wife and I stayed there for four days and had a wonderful stay. My brother is scheduled to stay there because of our recommendation. It is the ideal place to stay if you are traveling with children. we stayed at the standard apartment: very quiet, spotlessly clean and wonderful service. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “All reviews are accurate!!”
Reviews.Author: medicsLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a truly fantastic hotel, clean and very central. We stayed for 4 nights in one of the best apartments with our 2 children aged 9 and 7. We had a fantastic view of the canal and best of all we were only 1 minute walk from St. Mark's Square. Thank you Residence Corte Grimani for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Justnin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights during our honeymoon. It's a fantastic centrally located hotel. It is clean and spacious and unbeatable for the price. We were given great service and free Proseca sparkling wine. The only negative was that we had no view of any canal, just an 10 inch wide ally with construction rafters. Still we spent little daylight hours in the room and we were very pleased with the value of a hotel this nice. Word of warning: it's not easy to find the Grimani if your carting around a bunch of luggage, so take a Water Taxi upon on your arrival to Venice so as not to stress yourself to tears.

Reviews.Title: “Echoing the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: emiao
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 adults and 3 children) just returned from a 3 night stay at the property in a Superior Apartment. A terrific property with an absolutely terrific staff. They helped with restaurants, sightseeing tips. And even before we arrived, helped with securing a water taxi reservation, local guides, and tips on prebooking tickets to certain sights. All the previous reviews have captured the pros of the place...it's just worth mentioning again though that the staff makes you feel like family...when we left, we felt like we were leaving a friend's house...nothing like checking out at the front desk of a hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its #1 Status”
Reviews.Author: hdemott
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights with our 2 children ages 7 and 5. What the reviews here say is very accurate. The hotel is in a prime location, just off St. Marks Square - close enought to be extremely convenient and yet far enough to be away from the bustle. The fact that you look out on some small scenic canals helps, as does the building enterance - down its own little walkway. The boat landing also adds to the convenience (we came and went by water taxi - expensive but well worth it if you have a lot of luggage) The folks that run the hotel could not have been nicer and more welcoming to us - and were great for suggestions. All in all a wonderful stay in a clean and very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - but best for stay of a week or more or families”
Reviews.Author: outwardbound10
Reviews.Content: The location of the Corte Grimani could not be better - literally one minute from St. Mark's Square and a few minutes from the Rialto Bridge. It could not be more central and yet is just enough off the main route that you avoid noisy crowds - perfect. The apartments are very clean and modern and the service is excellent. Breakfast is available if you want it and reception will help you with maps etc. The photos on this website accurately show what the place is like. There is an extra charge for using the kitchen (50 euros). This is worth it if you are staying for a longer time or for families who cannot afford to eat out. There is also a washer/drier which is handy for longer stays. Our only gripe was that the room was very dark with another building only a few feet opposite our window. This is Venice and this is to be expected but don't be fooled by the photos that seem to show bright rooms with a nice view - these cost more.

Reviews.Title: “A very fine spot”
Reviews.Author: Bills2pay
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed two nights at the Corte Grimani and found it to be excellent. Very good location a short walk from St. Marks but quiet enough to be pleasant. We had an excellent two-room apartment on the 5th floor with a bit of a view. Very clean, comfortable, with a kitchen -- we used the refrigerator and microwave for no charge but were told there would be a substantial charge for real cooking in the room. The free computer in the lobby with internet access was nice, as was the "lending library" of Venice guidebooks and other local books in the lobby. The staff at the front desk were also excellent, very friendly and helpful. They made our short stay very enjoyable. We have no hesitation recommending the Corte Grimani and we thank TripAdvisor for helping us find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vasiliki4
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. It has all the comforts you need, together with a great and convenient location. The room that we stayed in was huge and clean. There is a gondola station just down the street and just a bit further is San Marco Square! We didn't try the breakfast that the hotel offered because there are tons of places to get something on the go throughout the streets. We had a 6mnth old and a 16yr old with us and all the conveniences helped out with both of them. The price was right as well, and as we wlaked around the city and saw some of our other choices, we were glad that our final choice was this one.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jeffsn
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review sitting in room 403 at the Residence Corte Grimani (yes, they have Internet access at no charge). I couldn't wait till the trip was over to post this, as the Hotel is wonderful. The only challenge for those not familiar with Venice is finding it, but that's Venice as we've discovered. My family of 4 is more than comfortable in the large "room"...actually a living area with a double bed, stove, fridge and washer/dryer and a bedroom. Plenty of room, teriffic location, just a short walk to the Piazza de San Marco and a staff that will help with just about any need you have from hotel questions (how does the washer/dryer work) to questions about where to go, what to do and how to book it. The breakfast offered is very acceptable and at 10 Euros per person a fine value. The only negative thing I could say is that all these great reviews will make it harder to book this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Steps to St Marks Square and simply lovely!”
Reviews.Author: ann_chicago
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor...without the reviews on this site, we never would have found this lovely hotel. I booked it because I had never read so many raves about the hotel, and now we would like to add ours. Our family, a group of 5 adults, stayed in two rooms; one on the canal and one not. Both rooms were very spacious and the furnishings and fixtures were top-notch. The canal room was great people-watching and we especially enjoyed the gondoliers singing as they paddled by our room--talk about ambiance! The room not on the canal had just a view of the next building but was very quiet which we enjoyed after returning from a long day of walking around. Either way the location can't be beat! During our stay, we used the kitchen and the washing machine; this was a special treat during our two-week 5 city trip, however the washing machine was very difficult for us to figure out how to use and we definitely recommend getting assistance with it if you are unfamiliar with european washing machines (it was a wash and dry all in one but took about 4 hours per load). Someone was always at the front desk to help us, and they assisted us with arranging for an early morning water taxi to the train station. BTW, knowing the name of the small canal that the hotel is on or having the map they provide to you when you arrive is invaluable when arranging for a water taxi. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. The only negative was they recommended a nearby restaurant to us, Acqua Pazzo, that was terribly unfriendly and we did not enjoy the food or the 25 euro cover charge for sitting outside. We told them the next day and hope that they take this restaurant off their list of referrals.

Reviews.Title: “you won't be disappointed !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ballyg
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful hotel. location couldn't be better. we stayed with 2 teenagers who moan about walking too far so they were well impressed .! you won't find people as genuine , friendly & helpful anywhere they really are fantastic. breakfast is 10 euro per person - but worth it cold meats , cheese ,breads , cereals , yoghurts, fruit juices , hot drinks , & freshly baked croissants plenty of choice. sets you up for the day. you can get a water taxi to the door should you wish. we flew into treviso got the bus to piazza roma & water bus to riallto then walked to hotel no bother as we travelled light. buy a three day pass for the boats well worth 30 euro this covers the islands as well we spent a day in lido what lovely warm water for a swim. nice beach, then we went to burano another day , a must its like no where else just picturesque. go to venice , everyone should & stay here in corte grimani you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value at Residence Corte Grimani”
Reviews.Author: cuda153
Reviews.Content: I'm happy to add to the list of highly deserved plaudits for this well-run hotel. Friendly, clean, spacious, helpful, good value, good location. We especially liked the location--tucked away but mere steps from both the Grand Canal and St. Mark's. Also, they were great at getting us a water taxi for our early morning trip to the airport--4:45 a.m! Mostly, however, we were impressed by the evident fact that these are genuinely kind and decent people--they're not just putting on a show for guests. We had 3 young children with us and they made us feel more than welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grimani”
Reviews.Author: PassengerX
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Corte Grimani after glowing 5-star reviews from TripAdvisor. The Corte Grimani is indeed, worth the 5-star rating. Upon our check-in at the hotel, we got a nice map, along with some restaurant recommendations. Our room was very nice and clean as well. We had enough room to stretch out! Breakfast was also delicious, with a fruit salad, some hot chocolate, and other breakfast items. We also got very friendly and helpful service from the staff during our stay. We even talked with the staff very casually too!

Reviews.Title: “Living Up to its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: dweymouth
Reviews.Content: With all the raves for the Grimani, I hardly feel the need to add mine. But it is a well priced, well managed, clean, quiet hotel that is close to the action but just around a quieting corner from it. The Grimaniâ€™s rooms are large and modern. (See attached pictures) We stayed there thanks to TripAdvisor reviews and were very happy. The only complaints about the hotel I can imagine are the lack of some bigger hotel amenities such as a full restaurant and room service, views, and the Venetian charm that comes with some of the older hotels. The available kitchens (full access requires an extra cleaning fee) make it especially attractive to families staying in Venice for several days, but I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Kookie
Reviews.Content: We agree with all the other comments, we booked because of the reviews on tripadvisor and they were so right. Yes it is a little more expensive than some but you get an apartment and after walking all day exploring it was great to come back to an apartment where you could sit on the lounge and have a cup of tea and watch CNN (only thing in english). The staff were fabulous and spoke very good english particularly when I got sick with a migraine and my partner needed someone to get me a doctor and then we had to stay an extra night and so we had to change plane tickets etc and the front reception staff were fabulous and ended up interpreting for us and it all sorted itself out. We highly recommend this place and it is in a perfect location too. My advice is bite the bullet and get a water taxi 100E straight to the door from the airport as after a long flight it is worth it but beware they dont always know the address so make sure you have ti with you and dont let them drop you off at St Marks square as then you have to walk, just insist on being taken to the door.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it really is that great!”
Reviews.Author: trvldoc
Reviews.Content: This place is pefection and it truly deserves to be number one on the tripadviser website. I booked this place largely because of the tripadviser reviews and it came through in every way. The staff are wonderful. The rooms are large enough for 4 persons. The bathrooms are polished white and large. It is beautifully located with St. Mark's about 3-4 short blocks away. All their restaurant recommendations were spot on. It is an easy 10 minute walk from the Rialto vaporetto station if you have a small suitcase on wheels. There is a fridge, a safe, and good air conditioning. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it...”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grimani for 3 nights, in late-May. My wife, our 19-year old daughter, and I thought it was great. All the front desk staff speak English, and are very helpful with any request you make of them, whether it pertains to the hotel, or anything at all in Venice. We have travelled a fair bit, including a lot of business travel on my part, and this is easily the most expensive hotel I have ever paid for myself. We paid 310 Euros per night, which was about $500 CAN, at the time. We've stayed in more expensive rooms, but using points, or getting some special deal. Having said that, it was still reasonable value, as the suite was great, and the location is about as good as you can get, as a tourist. What we liked: - Huge suite, with two bathrooms, and tons of closet space. We had the largest apartment size. - Location. Doesn't get much better. Central to everything. - Staff. Great! - Free Internet in lobby. Our daughter loved that. - Toiletries, slippers with the hotel name on them, even though there are only 15 apartments in the whole hotel. - Washing machine in the suite. - View. We were on the top floor. Don't misunderstand, there is not really a view of anything breath-taking, but you overlook a small canal and a couple of bridges, so it's quaint. - Super air conditioning. Thermostats and ventilation units in each room. Super effective. Nit Picking: - Didn't know about the shutters outside the windows until after I got home and read about them on the internet. No blinds on the inside of the windows, so it was a bit bright in the morning. - The charge to use dishes, etc. is a little steep, but not a big deal. They let you use glasses, the fridge, microwave and washing machine without extra charge. - Washing machine was a bit of a conundrum, even with the user manual, with instructions in English. The hotel was one of the highlights of Venice which, overall, was our least favorite stop in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: nugent17
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the wonderful reviews on this site, we booked the Residence Corte Grimani the last couple of nights in May. What a great place to stay. The apartment was so clean and nicely decorated. (there was even a washing machine in the apartment) The staff was very helpful and the location could not be beat! The Gondola's were steps away, and it was beautiful to hear the singing throughout the day and early evening. St. Marks square was only a block away. We were in walking distance to all the major attractions. The hotel even arranged for a private taxi to take us to Murano, and from there we took the ferries to Burano and Torcello. Just Beautiful! The breakfast is worth the 10 Euro's, and the restaurant recommendations were great! Thanks for all the other reviews, I would never have known about the Residence Corte Grimani if it weren't for this site, and it truly is the perfect place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DMEAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: This was one of be best hotel experience we have had in our years of travel. The room was spectacular -- immaculate, large, light and well-furnished. The folks who run this hotel are very special, helpful, cheerful and nice. They gave us many recommendations, all of which were great. Without question, I would stay at this hotel again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect jewell!”
Reviews.Author: Gangof5
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel in superb central location. At twice the price, it would still be a jewel. I've traveled in UK & Europe for years and one becomes accustomed to tiny rooms, dated plumbing & often less than scrupulous housekeeping, even in much more costly accomodations, but this is NOT the case at Corte Grimani. They excel in all aspects. I booked thru their website directly and found them to be wonderfully accommodating in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: trickytrotter
Reviews.Content: Three of us (myself, wife and 8 yr old son) stayed for three nights the first week in May. This great apart hotel was everything the other good reviews said. Ideally located less than 100 metres from St Marks Square yet quiet and in a relatively private spot. % m inutes walk back to St Marks in the evning when most of the crowds of day trip[pers have gone home. We found Corte Grimani easily enough arriving in the dark at 11.00 at night from Rialto. But pick the wrong alleyway and it is very easy to go round in circles. The staff were all delightful, always around to help, yet unobtrusive. Breakfast at 10 euros each was fine - few other options outside particularly with children. The apartment itself was brilliant, we had the basic option but had two very large rooms, one bathroom and one dressing room. Great value for money, free internet access in the lobby and free umbrellas on our very wet first day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family!!!!”
Reviews.Author: planning_queen
Reviews.Content: A huge thanks to the reveiwers on Trip Advisor for recommending this wonderful hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in early April in the large family suite on the 1st floor. It sleeps six but was incredibly spacious for our family of four. My husband is still talking about the comfort of the beds (including the queen sofa bed the chiildren used). In addition to the comfort of the room we were delighted with how quiet and dark the rooms remained in the early a.m. due to the metal shutters on the windows. We had requested a room with a view (when we booked directly with the hotel 8 months in advance) and had a fantastic one! The washing machine was an unexpected surprise. We used the PC in the lobby with free internet access quite frequently. The staff could not have been more helpful while we were there and prior to our visit! Email communication with the hotel prior to arriving was answered promptly and was very helpful. Location is perfect but far enough away from the crowds. This is a GREAT hotel! We strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Ambleside
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived back from a 4 night stay at the Corte Grimani, booked largely because of the raft of favourable reviews on Trip Advisor. I can report they were all correct! We took a standard room, minus the canal view (although we could see it out of the window if we leant out). We got an immaculately clean and beautifully decorated suite, with space and comfort to spare. The bed was huge and very comfortable. I absolutely cannot fault the room - they even provided a bottle of water in the fridge, which is a nice thought. We also took breakfast at the hotel, which was standard Italian fare of meat, cheese, cereals etc, but with fresh hot brioche and excellent coffee as well. I thought it was good value and excellent standard for the 10 Euro charge, particularly bearing in mind some of the prices elsewhere in the city. (e.g. the wholly risible Florian - 13.2 Euros/Â£9 for a cappuccino if they are forcing dodgy jazz down your throat. There are very nice cafes in lovely locations in the city where you could have 5 coffees for the same price. Absurd, avoid, and with a bit of luck they will go out of business). The Grimani's location is simply unbeatable, being about 3 minutes from San Marco and 10 minutes at most from the Rialto. Being tucked away on a side canal though, it is blissfully quiet at night, and during the day the only noise you normally hear is the regular "oy, oy" from passing gondoliers. And the occasional burst of "O Sole Mio" from the singing variety ... And a word for the staff, who were unfailingly polite and helpful, ever willing to assist and make our lives easier. The major hotel chains really should take note of this kind of service. Venice, of course, was majestic. As soon as you are off the day-trippers slog between rip-off St Marks and the Rialto, which is unspeakably awful during the day, it is just wonderful. If in doubt, dip down a side alley - any one will do - and walk. You will find a peaceful and remarkably normal place that presents something fascinating at every turn. Don't miss the Dosoduro or Canareggio, which are noticeably different in feel to the San Marco districts. We also took a trip out to Burano, which was both visually stunning and very charming. And finally, when we return to Venice, we will very definitely be staying at the Grimani. The price is good, the location superb, the service excellent, the standards high. The hotel and its owners and staff thoroughly deserve their high rating.

Reviews.Title: “It really is the best!! Thanks Trip Advisor!”
Reviews.Author: Gancarczyks
Reviews.Content: Thanks to fellow Trip Advisor travelers' reviews, we booked the Corte Grimani for three nights in late October. We were a party of three adults and four children. We had a spacious, immaculate apartment right on the canal. The staff is fantastic and had great recommendations for restaurants. I cannot say enough about the location. Right in between the Rialto area and St. Mark's Square. This was our children's favorite trip ever! The gondoliers passed right by our windows (all four of them!) facing the canal and we enjoyed their serenades without paying a ton of money for a gondola ride. A wonderful Venice experience that we will remember forever!

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: jak98
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading such positive comments from this site and we were not at all disappointed. We stayed here for 4 nights and on arrival we were upgraded to a larger room. The room was fantastic, large, clean, very comfortable, lots of hanging space in the wardrobes, 2 bathrooms! We took breakfast which provided cereal, fruit, yoghurts, croissants, bread, cheeses and cold meats - set us up for the day nicely. Location of the hotel was excellent - we could watch the gondolas go by from our room, although we did have some problems finding it initially as it's nicely tucked away from the main thoroughfare but still close to St Marks/Rialto. We really enjoyed our stay here and I would recommend this hotel to anyone - lovely hotel and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay and nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyAnnivTrip
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, we found that this was a favorite with customer satisfaction and cancelled our more expensive hotel due to the customer feedback. It is very confusing to get here: After taking the #1 stop on the vaporetti, go straight, turn right at your first opportunity and then left at your first opportunity. Go straight through courtyard continuing until you reach Timerland store. Then turn left (there was scaffolding there, but yes, that's the turn) and you will see a green awning ahead for Bon Vecchia, a new also good hotel with a great piano bar at night. Once you hit Bon Vecchia, Gucci is across the street, you can follow the hotel directions. When you see the bridge, there are stairs to the right of the bridge, go up a few steps off to the right around the bank and then you see it directly in front of you. I'm doing these from memory..you might want to check our BonVecchia's website for directions to their place and know that Corte Grimani is around the corner. I expected this to be more like some kind of efficiency since it was listed as an apartment, but we had maid service and the hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful!!! We paid 180 euros per night for two and they gave us a free upgrade! I was expecting very pared down efficiencies, but this is an old building that has been redone in the last couple of years and it was quite modern and nice. I had trouble finding the tiny washer and Donatella ran up to my room to help explain it quickly! They gave us good recommendations for dinners: Hotel Madonna and others. This is in a great location near San Marcos square and close to everything. Breakfast is an additional 10 euros per person so we opted out of breakfast. We enjoyed our time there and thought it was a great place! The lobby is quite small, but we were in Venice to see the city itself so it was fine with us! Also, we were celebrating an anniversary and they left chocolates and champagne in our room for the occassion!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: beachunter247
Reviews.Content: Short walk to St. Marks and Rialto Bridge. Clean updated roomy apartment. We, family of four, stayed two nights on our trip. Clearly the best place we stayed. Thick large terry towels and a great shower were well recieved after a long day sightseeing. Very pleasant staff willing to help with suggestions and booking of taxis. Will definitely stay there again, hopefully longer.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mineolakid
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern apartment with brand new bathroom and kitchen. We stayed here first on our Venice, Florence, Rome itinerary. I told my family this would be the best, though least expensive, hotel of our trip. Though we did well in the other cities, this turned out to be true. The owners could not have been nicer. We enjoyed their dinner suggestion (Acqua Pazza). The key to Corte Grimani, however, is the location, convenient to both St. Marks and the Rialto Bridge. Back home for two weeks now, we're still amazed we found this caliber of hotel in this location for such a good price (E180/night for party of five.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: HappyGroup6
Reviews.Content: We researched and researched Venice's literal HUNDREDS of hotels and couldn't have picked a more convenient and wonderful place to stay! Having just come from a 3 hour train ride from Lugano, Switzerland, 6 young Americans arrived in Venice intimidated by the confusing map that lay ahead of us. But after the quick, and breathtaking vaporetto ride dropped us off by the Rialto bridge, all we had to do was follow the signs that lead to the Piazza San Marco because the Corte Grimani was RIGHT THERE BESIDE IT! It was a welcome relief to have Donatella (who I had been emailing with for months) and her staff greet us at the front desk upon our arrival. Our room was home for only 2 days, but with modern meeting traditional furnishings, in addition to the many windows that opened to Venice's sights and sounds below (we were on the 5th floor!), it was time and money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: abroughton
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Venice was marvelous due in part to this great little hotel. The staff is highly receptive to emails and will answer all email inquiries promptly. The hotel is perfectly situated a short distance from St. Mark's Square on a small canal. The rooms are bright and airy with a small kitchen and large bathroom. It was a great place to take an afternoon rest before heading out for another adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bkmac
Reviews.Content: My 3 sisters and I stayed in the Superior apartment for 4 people. The apartment was surprisingly large, and was modern and clean. The two bathrooms were also very modern and nicely appointed. Best of all, the apartment overlooked two canals, and we enjoyed opening the numerous windows and people-watching. The staff were attentive and very helpful. We would certainly stay here again and highly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!!!”
Reviews.Author: beccahughes
Reviews.Content: Buongiorno, This was my first trip to venice and it was booked for my mother's 60th birthday. The first thing I would say about the apartments is that they are excellent accommodation for a group of people. There were 5 of us in our party and we booked the superior apartments which came to a little over 100GBP each for 3 nights. The apartments were clean, newly decorated and a delight to stay in. Almost every window had a view of the canal and it was quite tempting to remain in the kitchen/diner rather than explore. Our apartment had two rooms: a very large bedroom with ensuite bathroom containing a large double bed (two singles pushed together) and a double sofa bed, and a separate kitchen/diner with shower room. All the bedding was clean and comfy, linen and towels were provided as well as slippers. The apartment is around the corner after a bridge and a little difficult to find on foot but if travelling by water taxi (the expensive option) you can arrive on the doorstep. The staff are welcoming and friendly although beware of asking them to recommend restaurants and just wander off on your own. We, along with guests from other hotels, found ourselves in an awful establishment on the first night (the name of which I cannot remember now). Thankfully, Venice is scattered with lovely restaurants, its just a matter of walking around and stumbling upon them. We had breakfast one morning, which was a typical continental affair. I preferred the small tapas type venues whilst exploring. It rained whilst we were visiting in February and the apartments provided umbrellas which was nice. As you'll find from the other reviews, this is a real treat in Venice and just around the corner from St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. For the ladies, the delights of the designer boutiques which surround the apartment are diffcult to resist... Have a lovely time! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “There is no finer place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Italyl0ver
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, best location for visiting Venice.... I am extremely late in getting this posted, sorry Donatella, franca and Guido! First, we had an excellent experience with all of our communications with the hotel managers, Donatella and Franca. Upon our arrival, our check in was warm and detailed and a complimentary gift awaited in our apartment. This is definitely the place for you if you like excellent, non-intrusive service. Our maid service was very meticulous...service of the likes that we did not receive in other stays at "five star" hotels. We can not recommend this property enough... I am grateful to TripAdvisor and to previous guests who wrote their reviews, because this is how I found the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: traveler076
Reviews.Content: The three of us booked a classic apartment. There is a bedroom, a bathroom, and a kitchen/dining/living room area with a sofa bed. Everything was very spacious, and for E180 in November, it was the best value hotel of our stay in Italy. The streets outside are very quiet at night, except for the occasional singing of the gondoliere. There is no Internet access in the rooms, but at least they have a common station in the lobby that you can use for no extra charge. The kitchen is not available for use unless you pay an extra fee (I forget the exact amount, somewhere between E30-40), which was the only unpleasant surprise for us (I didn't see the fee on the website). We were able to use the fridge to stash our drinks, though. The bathroom is decently spacious. I enjoyed the heated towel rack (we Japanese like our bathrooms to have as many gadgets as possible ) and my non American hubby enjoyed the bidet. There was also a laundry machine in the bathroom, which we didn't use. The location is excellent in terms of being near San Marco. The drawback to being in this area, though, is that it seems all the restaurants in this touristy area are...how can I put this delicately...crap. The further away you go from the San Marco neighborhood, the better the restaurants (at least cross the Grand Canal). The staff are excellent. They are very friendly and helpful. Surprisingly, the hotel also had the best currency exchange rate in the area. We tried going to a couple banks nearby, but they did not exchange currency, and every other currency exchange place had a higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Susan66
Reviews.Content: After a five-day stay at the Corte Grimani, I have only positive things to say about this wonderful apartment hotel: - The apartment (we booked the standard one) was spacious, elegantly furnished and very clean. We were especially impressed by the bathroom, which was beautifully appointed and even included a bidet and laundry machine. - Use of a kitchen. For an additional EUR 35, a cupboard filled with basic kitchen utensils is unlocked. Sufficient for preparing simple meals. As eating out in Venice is rather expensive (and the food is not always that great - for Italian standards), we got a lot of use out of the kitchen. - Location, some 200 m from Piazza San Marco and close to all the other main sights in Venice. The hotel is amazingly quiet considering the very central location. - Great value. We only paid EUR 90 per night and booked through the hotel website. Even though January is low season in Venice, we still felt it represented a very good deal when compared to similar Venetian residences and hotels. Some tips: - We found the hotel without difficulty by using the instructions on the hotel's website. Still it would be a good idea to arrive in daylight. From Piazza Roma we took the vaporetti #1 and #82 in the direction of Rialto/Lido/Valaresso. Then we disembarked at Rialto and followed the hotel's instructions. - Buy a 72 hours vaporetto/bus ticket for EUR 25. It's definitely worth it when you want to visit Murano, Burano, Torcello or Lido. - For those considering self catering, we can recommend the Billa Supermarket located at the end of the Zattere across the San Basilio vaporetto stop (Dorsoduro). Great choice of hams, cheeses, antipasti vegetables, bread, olives, wine, etc. as well as the usual groceries.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: happyinyournappy
Reviews.Content: Having read the TA reviews, we decided to go for it. Great plan! We've stayed in various hotels and apartments (privately rented)in Venice and have never quite managed to get everything right. This place absolutely did. We had room to put our kids to bed and stay up with a bottle of Nebbiolo if we liked - or order the room service hot chocolate and pastas one night! - and space enough to eat in the diner area, while having the civilisation of a check in desk and gettgin your beds made every day. This place ticks all of our boxes and we would definitely recommend it and indeed go back. It doesn't have a breakfast set-up as such (you can take it in your room via room service, but it's easier to look after yourselves really). And I would avoid a courtesy Murano trip - our son was really keen to see glass being blown so we asked about the trip. All was great until it came to the hard sell. Luckily we had nerves of steel from somewhere and didn't come away wiht an unwanted glass objet, but it was very uncomfortable. We were a little naive here, and ought to have anticipated a 'sell' but we just didn't look beyond the picture. I think a lot of hotels offer this service, so be warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - family friendly”
Reviews.Author: EMM1907
Reviews.Content: This apartment hotel was great. We were travelling with young children and also parents and uncles and aunts. Everyone had their own room or apartment. Our family apartment had a lounge and full kitchen as well as huge bedroom. It was great as the children could amuse themselves and have snacks etc. It was exceptionally clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and we would definitely stay again. Only breakfast is served in the hotel in a very small dining area. We had a lovely view of the canal from our window and lots of gondolas passed by. It is very well located and near to everything. It is a samll hotel - only about 12 rooms so there are not lots of extra facilities. Very good value for money in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, simple, Internet falsly advertised”
Reviews.Author: Reuel_Tidhar
Reviews.Content: The residence is located near San Marco, very convenient. The staff is friendly, the rooms have kitchens (but a 30 Euro fee applies if you use them). Breakfast was simple and inexpensive (10 Euro per person, not included in lodging price) . The TV has only one channel in English (the ever repetitive CNN World). The hotel advertises Internet service, but does not have connectivity in the rooms. A single work station downstairs is limited to 15 minutes of use at a time. To me this is a deal breaker. If you say "Internet" on your website, you better have it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: claire-martin
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel. The apartments really do have a 'wow' factor, the location couldn't be better and the staff were so helpful. My partner and I got engaged in Venice last weekend and the hotel could not have been in a more romantic location. We had a small balcony on the second floor (apartment 201) which overlooked a typical Venetian bridge and a lovely canal. We waved at many gondolas as they sailed past. The hotel is between the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. We bought a three day vaparetto pass and really didn't need to because we were in such a fantastic location right amongst all the action. We were only 5 minutes away from St Marks Square and between sightseeing/shopping we were able to nip back to our apartment for a quick Prosecco and to rest our weary feet. The window shopping is excellent - we were around the corner from the Armani shop - and all the other designer shops were within minutes walk away. The hotel has nearly every up-to-date guide book on Venice and they are very happy to lend you copies during your stay. There's also a free internet service in the lobby. We had breakfast in the hotel one day. Not bad at all but it's just as easy (and cheaper) to wander into a cafe and get a cappucino and croissant on the hoof . We will definitely be returning to Corte Grimaldi during our next visit (maybe the honeymoon!!!).

Reviews.Title: “great location and peaceful, a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: winston_chops
Reviews.Content: just come back from a weekend staying here with my wife for anniversary. we booked a superior apartment at Â£125 a night. v clean and comfortable. the space in these apartments is huge - one large bedroom with ensuite plus one lounge with adjoining kitchen and extra bathroom. Prob too much space for a couple but the view of one of the bridges over the canal from the lounge is beautiful. leaving the window open to watch gondolas drift by was special. the staff were friendly and unfussy - they allowed us to use the hotel facilities (leave bags, internet, etc) after we had checked out in the morning. they do however lack food/snacks for those who arrive late like we did. Talking of which - finding the hotel is a nightmare if you arrive late at night. It is so hard to locate first time around (many locals do not know it) but that is part of its charm - it is hidden away - but a bigger sign or plaque on the hotel front would have helped. we actually went past it a couple of times before eventually finding it around midnight. one more thing: the only TV channel in english is CNN and there is MTV. not a big issue but would have liked more choice for those moments of kicking back and relaxing in between the hard work of walking, eating and sleeping...

Reviews.Title: “Yes, believe all the good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: PeterKelk
Reviews.Content: These are suites, not just rooms. Clean, elegant, quiet. Great bathroom, including washing machine, bidet, and view of canals. Breakfasts were very nice. The staff, Franca, Guido, Donatella, were great. They made me feel that they were only too happy to be of assistance. Location is excellent - very central, easy to walk everywhere. I planned to stay 3 nights, ended up staying 5. I am grateful to TripAdvisor and to previous guests who wrote their reviews, because this is how I found the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Corte Grimani is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: lgxtrip_boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Corte Grimani for three nights mid October. Walked from St. Mark's Square (after getting off the Alilaguna) - took us about 15 minutes. We could not find the hotel, and stopped in at another hotel for directions, the one directly across from Giorgio Armani. (We missed the sharp left immediately after crossing the bridge). It is in a quiet little nook, but still centrally located and easy to walk to all the key landmarks. Probably 10 - 15 mins walk to St. Marks. It was really easy to get around. We stepped into our hotel and received a warm reception. The hotel has an elevator, free internet in the lobby and a tv in the lobby. We were in a Classic Apartment configuration -- for two people, it was more than enough room. We also had a small side room, which we did not use at all. The bathrooms were nice sized with aand the water pressure was good. My only complain there is that the toiletries provided were very basic. The bed, linens, and pillows were comfortable. The drapes don't close all the way - so it might be difficult to sleep if you need the room to be completely dark (also might be tough to sleep in). One thing we did was we used the hangers (the ones with the clips that were in the room to close them together. The room we were in was quiet and there were no disturbances at night. There is also a mini kitchen with a washer/dryer (not a washer and a dryer just a machine that has both in there). We did not use it but could be very convenient if you wanted to buy food and cook. We got great recommendations from the hotel on places to eat and they were always spot on. Highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great place, location”
Reviews.Author: KWerner
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! I chose it because of other reviews on TripAdvisor, and they were all right! I didn't get the breakfast daily, because it seemed a little high priced, but its location can't be beat. It is definitely worth the extra money to get a room facing the canal, because the view is priceless. Rooms are huge, and amenities are ok ( no shampoo, bring your own). Clean and good room servicing. People at front desk helpful and speak good English. No internet in rooms, tho.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Corte Grimani
HotelInfo.Address: Corte Grimani, San Marco 4402 | Corte Grimani, 30124 Venice, Italy
